hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Transporter Wheeled 40L Duffel online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm on my third year of my Wheeled Transporter. I'm carryon only, and I've been around the world twice with it. I travel full-time as a nomad. This bag is the best carryon out there for two reasons: the wheels and the material. It withstands rain and can travel over every rock and pebble and cobblestone and curb out there. And, in the cases when I do have to check it due to weight, not size, the wheels survive the baggage handlers with no problem
review.name: Best Carry On for World Travel

review.reviewBody: I am a disciple of Rick Steves, so packing light and never checking a bag is a principle I hold dear. This bag is amazing. Light, water resistant, and able to fit more than you might imagine. I’ve taken it to Europe 3 times, and wheeling it around airports, train stations, and even on cobbled streets is a breeze. And when I need to carry it, it has plenty of grab handles to make it easy. Get you one!
review.name: Great bag for domestic and international

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned mine for a year and I love it. The padded compartment is great for folding shirts, dresses, etc, and they stay flat and isolated. Plenty of room on the main side, and straps cinch down to hold items in place. Effortless pull with the long handle and large wheels. Bag is fairly light, so more room for stuff and less concern about bag weight on the airline counter scales. I love the sleek outer fabric, which is weather resistant. Easy to squeeze down the size when scrutinized by wary travel clerks. I’ve taken this to several corners of the globe for two or three weeks at a time — even fit a foldable yoga mat as well. This bag, teamed with my Osprey day pack (both in the cool blue wave color), hold everything I need. Strongly recommend.
review.name: Perfect for most travel needs

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like it. the handle is a bit sticky and caught my index finger a couple of times. no blood but a blood blister. Over-all I’m happy.

s
review.name: I like it. the handle

review.reviewBody:
This would be the perfect travel bag, if the quality were consistent. 

What I love: the handles in all directions, the rugged, waterproof material, the wheels that can roll over any surface--even cobblestoned streets and gravel.

What I don't: the handle mechanism is made from cheap materials and poorly constructed. It wobbles from the get go, the screws come loose after a few trips, and on my bag the telescoping mechanism eventually locked completely, rendering the bag unusable. The handle was also the weak point on my last Osprey bag.

If Osprey were to fix the quality of its handles, this would be a perfect travel bag. This is my 3rd Osprey bag and I've traveled to over 140 countries, so I'm particular and certainly put a bag through its paces, but will switch brands after this bag disappointed on my last trip.
review.name: Quality Issues

review.reviewBody: I've been using this model overseas for about 3 months now, and it's performed well. It's highlights are the light weight, quality construction overall, and versatility. I bought this one after the previous version I had came to untimely end after getting snagged on something sharp. While I do like this bag I think the older versions were significantly better overall; the material was better, the inclusion of built in compression straps was highly useful, and I feel they were a little bit better built overall.
review.name: Good, but the previous versions were better.

review.reviewBody:
I had been in the market for a roller bag for several months and decided to go with Osprey, having a good luck with their backpacks.
However, on its first trip it has repeatedly been disappointing, zippers do not work smoothly, the wheels are already rattling like a bad shopping cart and wear marks on the soft exterior material are already showing. Just a 6 day trip with multiple flights and only overhead storage. I dread having to put it in cargo. So frustrating given the company's normal quality. 
Not worth the price at all.
review.name: Disappointed given the brand

name: Transporter Wheeled 40L Duffel

description: Buy the Grundens Boundary Stockingfoot Wader - Women's online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Boundary Stockingfoot Wader - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Grundens Boundary Stockingfoot Wader - Women's online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I had high hopes for these waders. I’m a women’s size 10 shoe. I ordered a size large. The stocking foot is WAY too small, probably a size 8 at the most. The quality of the waders seems good. I wish they fit as described.
review.name: Sizing is off

review.reviewBody: True to size, very well made and comfortable. I love the straps and the net hook on the back. Lots of adjustability. I'm tall so I need length and I was able to get it by extending the suspension system in the back. I found these to be a better fit for me than the other big name fishing company that starts with S. I followed the size chart and found it to be accurate with room to layer underneath.  The included wading belt is substantial and the GoreTex fabric feels top-notch. Hiked a few miles in these in late January to the fishing spot through a few brambles with nary an issue. Thank you Grundens for not putting any teal or pink on these.
review.name: Well Constructed with Quality Materials

review.reviewBody: When I heard Grundens was offering waders, I was really excited to buy a pair due to their stellar reputation. The waders are great quality, have all the right features and include an awesome wading belt.  The issue I had was the sizing appears to be off. I am 5’2” 115lbs and ordered the smallest size available - Small Short.  I was disappointed to find the waders were enormous on me.  There was so much extra fabric around my waist and hips.  Adjusting the wading belt to the correct size caused all the loose fabric to just bunch up.  I shortened all the shoulder straps and the adjustable suspension strap in the back and the waders still hung low around my chest.  Grundens Size Small would be more comparable to Medium in other manufacturers. I know this is their first foray into waders but hopefully Grundens will offer XS for us smaller folk and maybe even a zippered version like the mens in the future.
review.name: Really nice quality waders but beware of sizing

review.reviewBody: 20 days so far rowing boats and hiking in the Womens Boundary Waders and they exceed my expectations. Comfortable and durable, the waders allow me to move freely climbing over rocks and hiking. The 4 layer laminate in the lower body provides abrasion resistance and durablity.
review.name: Stay Dry and Comfortable

name: Boundary Stockingfoot Wader - Women's
Grundens Women’s Boundary Waders | Waterside Review

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. I like that the large feels like a large tall. Outside in single digits for hours and stayed warm. I like the stuff sack attached to the inside pocket so I can stow it in the pack if I get too warm.
review.name: Great parka

review.reviewBody:
The parka is decent but has noticeable flaws, including loose threads and small needle holes around the zipper, which could cause feathers to leak over time. Due to this lack of craftsmanship and attention to detail, I do not recommend this product.

Backcountry's packaging was equally disappointing. For such an expensive and bulky item, it was shipped in a thin plastic wrap without perforations, making it difficult to open without tools and risking damage to the parka. The parka was squashed into a small ball, and the package even had a dark footprint on it (as shown in the picture), suggesting it had been stepped on during transit. A sturdier box or padded packaging would have provided better protection. Overall, I'm very disappointed in Backcountry's cost-cutting on shipping at the expense of their customers' satisfaction, especially given the company's already significant profit margins (we all know how they manipulate the "price match" system).
review.name: Subpar details + packaging

review.reviewBody: I bought this for cold days, and I’m always chilly. Wore it for the first time on a night when it was in the low 20’s and 20mph winds. I was very comfortable, not a bit of chill!  Very earm, yet light weight!
review.name: Great coat

review.reviewBody: Great build quality while being super light and comfy. My only issue is the sizing. I have lots of OR gear and always wear XL. I'm 6'2", 220lbs with wide shoulders. This jacket fits up top but is absolutely huge around the waist. Maybe I got the maternity version?
review.name: Great build-odd sizing

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size, plenty of room for a helmet. I’ve only worn it out in the cold a bit to see how it heats up. Will update when I get a chance to test this more thoroughly.
review.name: Great fit, extremely warm

review.reviewBody: My unit got issued these when we were overseas. Down to -40F it was tolerable with a base layer and watch cap. Wind didn't cut through and it didn't limit flexibility as much as our 3 layer parkas. It was bulky, but we were doing admin stuff so it was a pretty neutral concern at the time. When it comes to extreme cold every day, this is the coat to get.
review.name: Fantastic Coat!

review.reviewBody: Bought this to climb & ski Cotopaxi and Cayambe in Ecuador. It kept me warm, not the lightest parka out there but it works great! It compresses down nicely as well.
review.name: Great for 6000m peaks

review.reviewBody: I use this all around in the cold climate. Super light, comfortable, and really warm. Only complaint is that the shell rips easily on a rouge branch or door appendage but that's my fault for not being aware of these types of dangers. This is the 3rd time buying this jacket. Usually lasts me 2 to 3 winters until my wife tells me it looks ratty. Scrunching up into the provided "scrunch" pocket into an 8" by 3" pillow has come in handy many times as a pillow or just to pack it away.
review.name: I have bought this product 3 times

review.reviewBody: Very good looking, great color, fits well, and is very warm. Looking forward to using it
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody: I have found this to be an exemplary parka, especially for its light weight, warmth, and compressibility / packability. It is soft and comfortable. There are similar parkas with a more element-resisting shell but most are less flexible and less versatile than this design. I highly recommend this parka.
review.name: Great Parka!

name: Super Alpine Down Parka - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Is it okay if I drink this any time?
I love the Horchata flavor! This is great to have after a hard, long ride especially if I have another one planned for the next day. It's somewhat easy for me to get an upset stomach with some nutrition products, but Skratch has proven over and over to agree with me. I would drink this for a snack even if I haven't ridden that day, it's that tasty.
Pro-tip, the Horchata mix actually makes a fantastic coffee creamer!
review.name: A special treat after working hard.

name: Recovery Sport Drink Mix - 12-Serving Bag

review.reviewBody: Received my hat late April and almost everything about the hat was clearly 5 stars.  The color, construction, look, feel, logo, etc are outstanding.  However, the fit is where the problems came in.  I don't have a extra large cranium (normal hat size is 7 3/8).  In order to get a proper fit, the hat is held together by only two of the small buttons/tabs.  Wished my first order had a bit better result.  Will still keep the hat and wear it when I don't need to worry about it being blown off!  Love the hat, wished it actually was one size fits all or even most!

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I ordered this looking for a lightweight, packable winter jacket.   Was excited to try it and SO looking forward to receiving it.   I am writing this review for two reasons: 
1) Set Expectations
2) Sizing
The sleeves are not insulated.  So this is something you may take out for a run, but you would not wear to walk around NYC.  It is more like a down vest with a sleeve for wind and rain.   The hood is not insulated either, though this matters less.

As for sizing:  I am 5'8" and 145 lbs.   D cup.  So based upon the size charts and models, I purchased a medium.  While this was stretchy enough to zip, it wasn't sitting in the correct position.   The waist line / back curvature was inching up too high.   When I let it hit naturally and unzipped, there was about a 1" gap, so clearly I would have needed to size up to a L (Large) if I were to have kept the jacket.
review.name: This is a very lightweigh piece; Not a winter coat
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the warmth, yet when you go inside you don't overheat. My picture shows where the lining is not down, rather a 'rubbery' mesh (not slick) and I read that's good for climate control next to your body. I had first ordered the Warm Cube Active Novus, synthetic lining everywhere except the hood--but the upper chest was a tight and squished the cubes. The down version with two chest pockets looked fine. No big athletic endeavors these days for me, but this has been a great jacket for snowshoeing, walks and errands. With fleece under it's been comfortable in the 20-30's if winds are below 20 mph, otherwise the arms get chilly. It sheds light rain.
review.name: Versatile Jacket

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I returned this, as it did not seem as warm as the synthetic lining version, which I had before, and it also seemed a bit smaller.  The lining on the arms seemed almost non-existent.
review.name: Prefer the synthetic lining

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this jacket for anything active! It seriously keeps the insulation warm when you need it at rest. In addition, it circulates a bit of air when you need it most during activities. It's great for anything you like to do in the outdoors! I should also say, it's my go-to for school drop off as well :)
review.name: Excellent Everyday Performance Piece

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Had to return this size xs jacket because it was too big for me (4'11", 100lbs), so I can't speak to the warmth.  Seems like it would have packed down easily, and I loved the orange color.
review.name: Runs large?

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warmer than you would think for how lightweight it is. My new go-to jacket for winter in California!
review.name: love this jacket

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket, versatile, lightweight, and warm. It is the perfect item to grab when out on a hike, or when running to the market, or really for any use. I have received so many compliments on it, and I am always so excited to share the many features it has and just how awesome it is!
review.name: Versatile!

review.itemreviewed: WarmCube Active Alt HB Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has become my favorite insulation piece to wear backcountry skiing. On clear days I use it as an outer layer for the climb and layer a shell over it on the ski down. I'm really impressed that I don't over heat while climbing and it saves me from the "be bold start cold" experience.
review.name: Great Layer For Touring

name: WarmCube Active Alt HB Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Kettle works great and have yet to use the cups camping. I assumed the base would be like the detour pots with the heavy base but they are not.
review.name: Detour Kettle set

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this cup and kettle kit for free from influenster and Sea to Summit for free in exchange for my honest opinion! Look at how freaking cute it is! I love it. I love that it is so easy to wash and can be collapsed down for easy storage and portability! It feels extremely durable and it heated up my water for tea perfectly. I can not wait to get more use out of this while camping! It is such a great set to have!
review.name: Perfect for camping!

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how easily compact-able this kettle set is compared to a non collapsible kettle when packing, it saved me so much room and I didn’t have to worry about losing a cup when they pack perfectly inside with the little rubber band. I used this with my gas camper stove and it heated up the water for my water surprisingly quickly for me, considering all the rubber. It did insulate the liquid and kept my drink hot for a good while compared to my all metal mug! Definitely getting more collapsing food gear.
review.name: Took up little space, made delicious coffee

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They are very practical and the model is simple and pretty, I love it because it can be stored easily and thus avoid losing them, the material is of excellent quality and durability, they keep whatever you put in it warm, I love the glasses, they are a good size and can also be stack them together to keep them together, the jug also has a band to keep them together after storing them due to the way they are folded and stored, they can be taken anywhere without taking up much space and always keep them together.
review.name: very pretty and resistant

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Can’t wait to try this next camping trip will totally be useful ! I love that u can do it all with so simple items ! I’m sure I’ll be happy with it . I really like it
review.name: Easy set up

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how heavy duty this set is it will last a lifetime it’s a camping staple also good to have for hurricane season here in Fl the heat distribution is great it heats up even and quickly and you can use it for so much from drinks to even soup I love it
review.name: Love

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are so cute and easy to carry in backpack or bag! They are very durable, easy to clean and they distribute heat all around. I actually warmed some soup on it and it worked great!! I can’t wait to use it again!
review.name: So easy to store

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This set looks strong and durable.  It’s folds flat so perfect for traveling.  It has expandable silicone side walls with stainless steel bottom to heated up quickly for tea or soup. Also the came with two cups inside so ready to drink.
review.name: Packable cooking

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As someone who loves the great outdoors and is an avid fisherman, this handy product is perfect for on the go. It is very durable and sturdy, I like to make soups and or just boil plain water. It also comes with two cups that collapse and are fairly a decent size, perhaps 2 cups worth
review.name: Awesome

review.itemreviewed: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Received this product for free from Influenster in exchange for my honest review. Finally got it and me and my girlfriend were so excited to try it and we did in our back yard made some smores and some hot tea over the fire. It’s so easy to clean and also wow amazing to carry around fits everywhere. Really keeps the tea pretty hot so goood quality for sure!
review.name: Amazing!

name: Detour Stainless Steel Kettle Cook Set - 2 Person

description: Buy the MSR MiniWorks/WaterWorks Maintenance Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MiniWorks/WaterWorks Maintenance Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR MiniWorks/WaterWorks Maintenance Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It's great to have a rebuild kit available. Thanks
review.name: It's great to have a

review.reviewBody: Good kit. Wish it also had the foam float. I lost mine, but it’s not critical to the operation
review.name: Good kit. Wish it also

review.reviewBody: I only needed to use the silicone grease; the rubber rings and duckbill valve were soft and pliable, just added a new layer of grease.
review.name: I only needed to use

review.reviewBody: I did a very foolish thing by not servicing my water filtration pump before a one month sectional hike on the AT. Sure enough, in my third week my pump failed. Without the help of another hiker, I would have been toast. I now have completely serviced my pump with the MiniWorks Kit and my pump is like new. I also have a backup kit in my gear. Don’t leave home without one.
review.name: A must for serious hikers

review.reviewBody:
I finally used this kit for my MiniWorks last year while out. All the O-rings had worn out. However, I bought it years ago. It had a new umbrella valve in it as the MSR site presently states. What it didn't have, at least in mine, was the spring that goes with the washer and duck bill valve.  Although I didn't need to replace that, it's probably one of the easiest things to drop and lose.

When I buy a new kit, I'll make sure I call MSR and have them send me anything that's missing, including the spring. They used to be real good about that stuff. Hopefully, they still are.
review.name: What's missing?

review.reviewBody: Does not have ball in the parts. And that is what we need.
review.name: Water filter replacement parts

review.reviewBody: Just what we needed to fix up our water pump. It's OLD and hasn't been maintained in years, but this kit and a bit of time and some youtube video instruction now has it working like new again.
review.name: Has old pump working like new again!

review.reviewBody: I've had the MiniWorks water purifier pump for nearly a decade and an o-ring failed about 2 years ago. I considered buying a new pump but was pleasantly surprised to find the maintenance kit. My pump works just like new.
review.name: Good as new

review.reviewBody: piece of mind knowing that you have a compact repair kit on long backpacking trips when clean water is important.
review.name: compact repair kit

review.reviewBody: I bought this because my MSR filter that I have owned for 10 years no longer worked properly. After following the clear instructions and replacing a few pieces- it's as good as new!
review.name: Definitely purchase again in another 10 years!

name: MiniWorks/WaterWorks Maintenance Kit

description: Buy the S.O.L Survive Outdoors Longer Solar Shower - 20L online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solar Shower - 20L
hasVariant.description: Buy the S.O.L Survive Outdoors Longer Solar Shower - 20L online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for an easy wash off station at a backcountry hut, it is great! The water heats up throughout the day from the sun and has a temperature strip to see how hot the water is. I was surprised at how little we used for rinsing and doing a spit style bath - no one washed hair though. Looking forward to having this for my dog too.
review.name: Great camp shower! Hard to dry out after

review.reviewBody: Couldn't even use this once before it broke. Bladder is impossible to fill in a lake or creek without a cup to pour or a waterfall. I hung it up in the sun at the campsite while I hiked and when I came back all but 1L had leaked out through the hose connector and the water that was left was still somehow cold. (Shower head nozzle was fully closed when I left it I'm not an idiot) This thing is cheap quality I do not recommend.
review.name: Waste of money

review.reviewBody: Did a test drive on this bad boy before I take it out... filled er up with regular ole water and let it outside in the sun a few hours, temp on side has F and C options to read and when I hung this up in the shower, let me tell you that water was hot and you can fit a good amount in there for a nice hot rinse shower on any camp or paddle trip. 100% recommend and can't wait to take this on every trip I can now!
review.name: That's some hot water!

name: Solar Shower - 20L

description: Buy the MSR Guardian Gravity Water Purifier online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Guardian Gravity Water Purifier
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Guardian Gravity Water Purifier online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very satisfied. Used every day to provide drinking water for a family of five in the Philippines.
review.name: Very satisfied. Used every day

review.reviewBody: utilisation is very simple. i drink lake water all week and i was ok.
review.name: pure water less effort

review.reviewBody:
If budget is no object - then this is the filter to buy. I also have the Sawyer Gravity system which costs 4x cheaper. Not just a mere filter, it is a also purifier - and the carbon filter is the icing on the cake and makes the filtered water pleasant tasting. Everything about the package is pure premium. MSR did not skimp on the components and it looks and feel as expensive as it actually is.

Operating is easy. Long term storage is a bit tedious - it is a 1 hour procedure - but I don't mind doing to ensure tip top performance and longevity.

I know some complain about the flow rate. I never measured - I mean between the claimed 2 mins to reputedly slower 2m30secs in the field .. it is rather irrelevant to me for my use. Which is base camp use where I wont be moving for days. Part of enjoying the outdoors is the being calm about everything and 10L filtered water that comes about a few mins late, is a non-issue for me. And it is really great to produce so much filtered water for camp use effortlessly AND it is supercomforting to know that it is (if the claims are to be believed) the only filter to meet military grade specifications. That seems overkill for me but then why not! 

Downsides : long term storage and PRICE. This filter is insanely priced.
review.name: Absolute Best Gravity System in the Market

review.reviewBody: Have used this rig in the BWCA multiple years.  A great setup that makes base camp next level.
review.name: Safe water fast, thank you MSR!

review.reviewBody: It's just a great and reliable system. Even my kids can use it. We are a family of 5 who go camping with friends and we need a lot of water often we use 70 liters on a weekend. With the gravity system we never run out of water and the system does not require attention so it's very good for camping with small kids.
review.name: Awesome system

review.reviewBody: After reading The Road by Cormac MacCarthy I purchased both a Guardian and a Guardian Gravity Purifier. I figure that they will either not get used much or they will save lives in the long run. That said I now only have the Guardian Purifier as my Guardian Gravity Purifier was donated by me to a disaster relief friend. Now all I need is a sale for me to be able to buy my family another one.I am glad I helped someone but now I can't afford another one. I never even got to use it.
review.name: Gravity purifier Guardian

review.reviewBody: Great filter! Just check it first before taking into the field, my dirty water bag had a defect which made it leak at the port. I was able to fix this by jerry rigging it with my dromedary bag. Good that MSR uses standard connections. I do recommend.
review.name: No more pumping!

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this filter two years ago for big group and family trips. This year my wife and I took our two kids on an 11-day trip on the Wonderland Trail around Mt. Rainer. The filter performed great, even in dried-up silty/tea-stained lakes. At first, I thought this filter was overkill - many people use squeeze bottle-style filters. Though having to make water for the four of us over 11 days, I was happy I did. Most days, I was filtering around 20 liters of water per day. We filtered into a separate 10l bladder so anyone could quickly fill the cook pot, bottle, or brush teeth.

When stowed, the filter, dirty water bag, and extra balder are chunky. However, the weight is negligible once you put this into the group gear pile that gets divvied up between the party. It was consistent with other group gear items in size and weight - rainfly, first-aid kit, stove and fuel, etc.

Lastly, the flow rate is brought up on this filter. The filter works great if you hang it high and routinely flush the system. At the end of each season I've owned this, I "winterize" the filter by following the disinfecting directions supplied with the filter. This extra step makes a big difference in the overall performance of the filter.
review.name: Used on 11day trip on the Wonderland

review.reviewBody: Have now taken this filter on several back country trips and can attest that it works for filtering water, but beware it is slow as molasses. Even following all instructions in the owners manual and using tap water, the fastest flow rate I could get was 5 minutes per litre. This is 2 1/2 times slower than advertised and about 5 times slower than the regular MSR gravity filter. Would highly suggest not to get this filter unless you are in an area where it is absolutely necessary to have protection from waterborne viruses.
review.name: Slow

review.reviewBody: I purchased this as an alternative to iodine treated water. Our 9 person crew used this exclusively for our drinking water for 10 days. Best paired with a dromedary instead of filling directly to nalgenes.
review.name: Used for boundary waters trip with no problems.

name: Guardian Gravity Water Purifier
Guardian Gravity Water Purifier

review.reviewBody: I needed to upgrade my old Giro with something new that had the MIPS safety structure. The Helios fits the bill perfectly. It’s light, fits me perfectly, cool with good ventilation and it looks good. The adjuster on back works well and keeps the helmet firmly on my head. Straps are narrow and comfortable. I haven’t used this in really hot weather yet to see how the sweat control works. I’m very happy with the helmet so far.
review.name: Nice Helmet

review.reviewBody: Great fit in a lightweight helmet.  Pretty much disappears once I start pedaling. Don't even know it's there. But confident it will do what it needs to do.
review.name: Disappearing helmet!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight with lots of vents for air circulation.  Nice piece of cycling equipment.
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody:
Very light and airy design, and the shell within a shell MIPS design is slick - gone are the days when the MIPS helmets all were like a mushroom up top. 

But compared to a similarly top of the line Bell which I had previously, the sweat management is one of the worst I've used. Really no control of sweat which pours into my eyes either climbing or descending. Disappointing at this price.
review.name: Great design, bad sweat management

review.reviewBody: I've used it for about 3 months until I was on a very big car accident.  Having this helmet on saved my life and absorbed most of the impact that the car directed towards my face and head.  I wouldn't be writting this for sure if I didn't have one of these mips spherical helmets on my head at that time.  I definitely will replace the damaged one with another giro but I'm saving it as a "memento mori" and I do recommend giro.
review.name: This helmet saved my life

review.reviewBody:
I started cycling one year ago and have now cycled 3,200 miles. I am now at a turning point where I learned this past month how to clip into my pedals and have been practicing on paved trails. Now that I am ready to transition back to the main road, clipped in, I wanted the most secure helmet I could find on the market so I purchased this helmet. It is comfortable out of the box and I hope to never find out how the spherical technology works. I trust the Giro brand. They make helmets for skiing and cycling, two riskiest sports.

**Update** I have worn this helmet a couple times and find it super comfortable. Love it happy with my black helmet!
review.name: comfortable out of the box

name: Helios Spherical Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody:
This vest is thin (as the title states, lol). Ostensibly, it's a 700 down fill? Very little loft. Maybe because it's recycled down? Idk. I'm not going to return it, I'll put it to use, but i wouldn't buy it a second time.
I got this for a good sale price-had I paid full price, this item would DEFINITELY get returned. Also, runs a bit small, perhaps because it's 'stretch'? I purchased a M as I like my outerwear a bit loose & it sort of tight w a hoodie underneath. 

No coat hook tab, no inside pocket. Construction feels a bit cheap. For something that retails for over 200$, it should have an interior zip pocket. It does have zippers on the outer pockets, so +1 for that. 

All in all, this isn't all that.
review.name: It's THIN.

review.reviewBody: I love this vest. The color is spot on and it is so warm and cozy, the perfect item for the PNW!
review.name: So Warm and Cozy

review.reviewBody: Nice fit very comfortable great to find a gilet with a hood
review.name: Nice fit very comfortable great

review.reviewBody: I love this!! It's super warm and cosy, the fit is perfect and it looks amazing. The perfect gift for the outdoorsy person! !
review.name: I love this!! It's super

review.reviewBody:
Excellent quality, very warm and light to wear. 

Only minor disappointment is there is no coat hook tab. Otherwise love the jacket and will return to Rab in future.
review.name: Excellent quality, very warm and

review.reviewBody: This stretch down vest is like wearing a big warm hug. The outer fabric is a lovely matt finish, soft to touch and enclosing a thick layer of down. It's a perfect vest for working from home to ward off the autumn chills - but much better as an outer layer for cool dry walks. The stretch fabric cuts out any cold spots and looks great. I would suggest that it is sized a little large, but it depends on what you intend to wear under it.
review.name: Supersoft and cosy

name: Cubit Stretch Down Vest - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Kaptiva Trail Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I used to own the previous version, which I really liked (gray with pink details). I was hesitant to order the new version based on the reviews.

I ordered the same size, 41 (I typically order a 39 for sandals and a 40 for running shoes).
They're built almost exactly the same, except for the arch, which seems a bit higher.
I used them several times on a trail, and am just as happy with them as the older version.

People in the reviews were concerned about the glue in the new version, but my older version also has a small spot where the rubber detached on the toe box. This doesn't bother me, and they served me for a long time. I thought I could always glue it back together if needed.

Love the color red, especially with a little dust on it!
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: I bought this pair just a couple of weeks after buying my first pair of La Sportiva shoes simply because they are such a perfect fit for my feet. As a former dancer, I have incredibly high arches and finding shoes with appropriate arch support has always been a challenge. I was delighted to discover unparalleled arch support in these shoes! My feet feel cradled in support.
review.name: Supportive with excellent arch support

review.reviewBody: Please don't discontinue the Kaptiva's, La Sportiva! Having narrow feet and high arches, I have struggled to find a proper fitting trail running shoe for over a year, and these are the winner. I was on the Bushido 2's for a few months, but they did not have enough support, and I found myself severely pronating on my right foot. The fit was a little small, since sizing up made my heel slip, and I found them to be very warm. I researched a similar shoe and came across the Kaptiva. Same heel drop but a far superior fit. I followed the other reviews and purchased a full size up, from a 7.5 to an 8.5, and they are perfect. The toe box is roomy, but not overly large, allowing adequate room to spread my toes. The heel cup is high and keeps my heels in place. The tongueless gaiter-like wrap around the foot is fantastic; holds my foot in place but stretches for uphill and downhill terrain. The lacing is simple and doesnt dig into my feet or come loose. The construction is robust and holding up really well on knarly, rocky terrain. Shoes are responsive so you can feel the ground underfoot, but are stiff enough to support the inner foot from pronation. The toe construction is awesome at protecting, and seemless design has no weaknesses to wear down. Breathable, but doesn't sacrifice any durability. I feel nimble and efficient on these. If I had to be picky, I would ask for more color options. I think this shoes would be great as a racing shoe, but think it can be promoted as an excellent daily trail runner. Please keep this shoe!
review.name: Better than the Bushidos!Please don't discontiue!

review.reviewBody:
I really, really wanted to love these: they fit me so well, and their tread pattern was perfect for the mountain running I had ahead of me last summer. The tongue feature was a great idea too...

Alas: shoe began falling apart on my first 20 miler into the alpine. Over trail to rock and across streams, the external material slowly because unglued from the internal mesh. And now, I'm left with a shoe that looks completely blown out and gets a million tiny rocks stuck between the two layers.

For a brand whose sticky rubber is so famously durable, I can't believe La Sportiva skimped on the glue quality here. This was probably my biggest disappointment in gear purchases in years!
review.name: Wanted to Love Them

review.reviewBody: Bought this at Australian Ultra. Fell in love! Wish they were sold in SA too
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: After putting these on and test driving them, I have to say I love these more than my APL running sneakers! They have the same flexible fit material which I love as they bend and flex to the shape of your foot but the part I fell in love with the most is the bottom sole. The traction sole really helps to protect my feet and feels comfortable as well! Overall very, very happy! Note - Runs small and I?m normally a size 9, sometimes 9.5 and I went with the 41.5 and they fit perfectly!
review.name: Now my favorite jogging sneakers!

review.reviewBody: I've loved the Bushido I and Bushido II, but heard good things about the Kaptivas as a lighter, more race-oriented shoe and wanted to try them out.  These shoes are awesome! They just felt fast from the minute I first put them on.  No blisters thanks to the sock liner.  I have very narrow feet, so it is tough to find shoes that don't cause my forefoot to slide around - a very unnerving feeling when running on very technical, rocky trails in the mountains.  The only downside is that they seem to run a tad smaller than other Sportiva shoes and I should have paid more attention to reviews here.  After several runs in them, I purchased a second pair a 1/2 size larger and they fit much better.  If you are on the edge of sizes, size up a little bit.
review.name: Light AND solid

review.reviewBody: After running in various other trail shoes, the Kaptiva is my new favorite trail shoe for short to mid distance trail runs.  It is light, comfortable and very responsive, with fabulous traction on wet rocks.  With plenty of space in the toe box, yet snug fit in the heel cup, this shoe is comfortable from kilometre 1 to kilometre 20!
review.name: Light, comfortable and grippy!

review.reviewBody: Just received my 6th pair of Kaptiva's in anticipation of having a fresh pair for an upcoming race and I still love them just as much as my first pair!
review.name: Can't get enough

review.reviewBody:
Kaptiva offers very nice features and an agressive grip. I usually wear size 7 in my trail running shoes. But with la Kaptiva, i had to return and order a size 7,5.
Also, this shoe is made for narrow feet, wich didn’t let my toes spread while running and the feel is a little less stable.
review.name: Fits small

review.reviewBody: Comfy and warm! It’s my go to for around the house, out on the town, or out on the trail!
review.name: Great vest!!

review.reviewBody: Size medium fits well, I’m 6’ and approximately 150lb. Vest is very warm. Chest pocket and internal pockets are a nice touch. One minor thing is the internal loop for hanging on a coat rack could be just a little bit nicer.
Super nice vest   light and comfortable..... fit is on point
review.name: Outdoor research  helium down

review.reviewBody: Got this for a ski trip to whitefish. Temps get pretty cold on the mountain compared to hood so I wanted an extra layer. This thing is toasty but also super comfy. Since the ski trip I have been pairing it with my rain jacket in dog walks. Full down sleeves make me too hot in the spring. Love to wear this at my desk in the morning while I warm up and get my day in full swing.
review.name: Midlayer upgrade, great rain shell pairing

review.reviewBody: This vest fits as advertised, layers well beneath a shell, and looks good when worn by itself. I wear for skiing when additional warmth is needed but without the bulk of a down coat.
review.name: Excellent fit and great for layering

review.reviewBody: Construction quality seems good, but it's not a good fit for athletic build. I'm 6'0", 175lbs, and long arms. The arms of the Medium are actually long enough for me, which was great, but the body (torso) was too short and loose-fiting. Returned it after trying on so can't comment on durability. Also would have been nice to have a cinch to tighten back the hood for better visibility.
review.name: Boxy cut

review.reviewBody: This vest is GREAT. It is also extremely warm. We've had temps in the teens for the last few weeks and this has been excellent at keeping me warm. I had a seam issue with my prior vest from OR and the return and replacement was so easy. Great company and will continue to buy from them.
review.name: Men's Helium Down Vest

review.reviewBody: I am 6' tall, 175 and the large fits perfect. It's warm and looks great.
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought the vest because I love the hooded jacket. First rate quality and super comfort! Can't wait for cold weather.
review.name: Love the Helium line!

review.reviewBody: Very good quality and extremely warm for a vest. I am 5'7 and the medium got me perfect. The chest pocket fits my iPhone 13 and the hand warmers are lined on both sides and feel nice. The arm holes are sized correctly compared to some other brands that I couldn't wear due to them being to small if you have an athletic build. I love to layer this under my chore coat and parka.
review.name: Great quality and look.

name: Helium Down Vest - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I've been wearing surf wetsuits since the 1970s and this is the most comfortable one I've ever worn.  The neoprene is extremely soft and flexible, making it easier to paddle and pop up.  The suit is also easy to get into and out of, even with frozen fingers.  There is a slight tradeoff in warmth, so if your body runs cold I would consider getting the Hyperfreak Fire or moving up to the 4/3.

Regarding fit, I'm 5'7" and 140 pounds, and the MS is a good fit.  The torso on these suits is slightly longer than most other brands, which is good for me.
review.name: Very comfortable and easy on/off

review.reviewBody: I bought this wetsuit for my husband after I used one myself. The material is comfortable and flexible which means it doesn’t feel quite as restrictive as other long wetsuits we’ve used.
review.name: Warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: an amazing coat for comfort. not the warmest but warm enough on most days of winter
review.name: FRANKLY.......

review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket and it is my go-to for errands and around town/walking to work. I have it in a navy blue and I get a lot of compliments on it. It's quite flattering. I love the 2-way zipper and the length, and the hood. But, it is not quite warm enough for super cold conditions. It is only 600 fill, so something to take note of.

I'm 5'3", 130lbs and wear a small. I'm a 27/4 in most pants and a small in most tops. The fit doesn't work with bulkier layers underneath (especially those with lots of material in the arms, as the arms of the jacket are pretty narrow), but it's fine with regular-weight and -fit sweaters.
review.name: Not the warmest

review.reviewBody: I love that the sleeves go down over my wrists and keep them warm; also keep the gloves tucked in while I'm reaching. I love the deep pockets and the puffy collar lined with so soft fabric. I love the not fussy 2 way zipper and the adjustable puffy hood. I love the breathability of the jacket and how it keeps the wind from getting through. I love it's light weight and length (long enough to keep my butt warm). I love that it is roomy enough for a fleece layer but fitted enough to wear by it's self. I just wish it had an inside pocket. That's the reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5.
review.name: Love My Jacket!

review.reviewBody: I used this jacket for the backpacking trip. It was light and warm. I like that it is a longer jacket in particular and very light and packable.
review.name: Warm

review.reviewBody: I'm a woman size 8 and in my opinion a size medium would be my size but I could have sued a large.  36B and 148 lbs.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody: Liked the jacket, but not the raisin color. Looked more burgundy online, but is too brown for me. Jacket is comfortable, light but warm and liked the adjustable hood.
review.name: Very nice jacket

review.reviewBody: I highly recommend it. It is extremely light, warm, and soft.
review.name: Soft and warm

review.reviewBody: Great coat! Love the color and it is very warm. I’m 5’4” and it comes just below my bum, which is what I wanted.
review.name: Warm coat

review.reviewBody:
I have been wearing these for three months and actually bought a second pair just in case you phase this style out, which it seems like you are going to. We got a bad downpour the other day and my feet got wet. I’m very disappointed.
I wish I could Get the Moab Gore-tex Low boot in an Eight wide. It looks like you are phasing out the Gore-Tex and the waterproof low boot in this model. Not a very good business decision, I don’t think.I am going to have to search a different brand now to get a real waterproof/Gore-Tex low boot.
review.name: Not really waterproof in the rain

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable with good support. Size 8 medium width.
review.name: True to size
comment: Thank you for the great feedback!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are relatively light weight but still rugged enough for rocky terrain.  The waterproof is good for rain and low water crossing.  Your feet will get wet if you submerged the shoe.  The material in the uppers is breathable and dried quickly.  This is my second pair of these shoes.  The first pair is still going, I just like to alternate my shoes.   I have been hiking for a year several time a week in Boquete Panama.
review.name: My go to hiking shoe.
comment: Thank you!

review.reviewBody: I live in Seattle so waterproof boots are a must for my daily walks. I am on my second pair!
review.name: Wet climate
comment: Thank you for the rating!

review.reviewBody: Comfy right out of the box, just like my last pair of Merrells that finally gave up the ghost after 10 years.    Purchased for a European trip where I knew I'd be doing a ton of walking.   These were perfect.   My 55 year old feet and legs never ached or got tired and we walked many miles per day.  Waterproof, so I was fine walking through drizzly Parisian cobblestone streets.   They would be great for heavy duty hiking too.   For lighter duty walking, such as on a path, I would probably pick something slightly lighter weight.
review.name: Comfort and performance

review.reviewBody: These fit comfortably right out of the box.  I did not have time to break them in as I bought them right before a trip.  Had a wonderful time hiking in the El Yunque rainforest in Puerto Rico. And they are cute!
review.name: Perfection!
comment: Thank you for your awesome feedback!

review.reviewBody: My feet started hurting as soon as I put them on. The arch was not in the right spot for my my feet. They are extremely rigid.
review.name: Not a good fit for me

review.reviewBody: The Moab 3 waterproof hikers were a gift for my daughter-in-law who, with my son, owns a small hobby farm in Missouri where they manage gardens that include pumpkins and berries, started some fruit trees, and care for ten chickens.  This is the second pair I gifted to my daughter-in-law, the first of which (after much wear and tear from daily use) gave up the ghost this summer.  The hikers have also been used for hiking.  I'll get her another pair in 2-3 years when she wears these out.
review.name: Merrell Helps the Productive Produce

review.reviewBody: Love 'em! Super comfy for day hikes and very little break-in time
review.name: Very happy!
comment: Thanks for your great review!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes because they are warm, comfortably fitted on the first few days of wearing without needing to break them in. They are definitely waterproof as I've been wearing them whenever it pours or snows. They are a bit heavy for everyday wear, but once a week is good enough for me. I walk several miles a day to and from work by choice, so I prefer lighter weight shoes. These are Moab 3 are great.
review.name: Great Waterproof Shoes, get them

name: Moab 3 Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Teva Hurricane Drift Sandal - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hurricane Drift Sandal - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Teva Hurricane Drift Sandal - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these for Electric Forest, a 5-day camping dance music festival and they were the best purchase of my entire weekend, including a bevvy of camping gear, etc. These are so comfortable to walk in, dance in, and stand in, I was SO glad I decided to get a pair to try out. I liked the styling and reviews said the foam material was nice, which is an understatement. They fit perfectly and they're comfortably snug without being binding. 11/10 footwear. (Buy 1/2 to 1 size under your gym shoe size, as you should always do with sandals, since you won't be wearing socks!)
review.name: Best Sandals Of All Time

review.reviewBody: My pair of Ceramic (turquoise) are great! They are a 1/2 size bigger than marked size, but thats better than smaller. Love how grippy they are in wet conditions. Wide sole also helps in rocky stream conditions. Only had these for 2 months, but no problems.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: The sandals were not the quality that I expected from Teva. They were very large and bulky. Also, the cheap material was uncomfortable and disappointing. I am just grateful I was able to return these with minimal hassle.
review.name: Too large, bulky, and cheap

review.reviewBody: I wear these almost everyday... yes with socks!! they are roomy and comfortable...
review.name: I really like these!

review.reviewBody: Loved the idea of the sandal but when I put them on they felt rather cumbersome and inflexible. Also, the design didn't allow the front strap to adjust, and I was left with lots of open space between my foot and the sandal - no way for it to feel secure. Maybe they would work for someone with the exact right foot, but sadly not for me.
review.name: Awkward, Cannot Adjust

review.reviewBody: The rubber ankle strap snapped while I was walking in them. I wore them a handful of times, without doing strenuous activity, before they broke.
review.name: The quality was surprisingly bad

review.reviewBody: Had to return and get a size down. They run very large. Super wide toe area which is not adjustable either.
review.name: Way too big

review.reviewBody: 3 weeks on pavement, 3 to 4 miles a day and the sole is now completely gone. Worst Teva's ever!
review.name: 3 weeks on pavement, 3 to 4 miles a day

review.reviewBody: I had to return my shoes for an exchange, and I haven't received them yet. I love the shoes, but I need them for my trip.
review.name: Return

review.reviewBody: Won't ever purchase online again as no return address. Sorry Alps isn't in business any more.
review.name: I tried them on and threw them away as the sizing didn't go.

name: Hurricane Drift Sandal - Men's

description: Buy the MSR Elixir Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Elixir Tent: 4-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Elixir Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The first time we used our tents it was fantastic! Easy use and rode out a thunderstorm in style. 

A few years later, we broke out the tent again and all of the tape on the fly seams had completely delaminated and crumbled! We have several tents by other brands which held up way better than this! We liked the design of the tent but if it won’t keep you dry, the tent is worthless - a lot of money to spend for a single-use tent.

I reached out to support two weeks ago and am still waiting for a reponse…hopefully they can help.
review.name: Leaks like a sieve

review.reviewBody:
Lots of room for two 6 foot plus guys. 
easy to set up.
review.name: Lots of room for two

review.reviewBody: MSR sent me a new tent fly. I’m very happy with the tent.
review.name: Chris N

review.reviewBody: I purchased the MSR Elixer two seasons ago ... it is roomy and vestibules hold plenty. My concern is with the delaminating fly seams and the localized lost water repellence I wrote to MSR customer care almost six weeks ago with no response to date but would like to know my options regarding either the replacement of the fly or where I could purchase of a new one so I can continue using the tent. Given my warranty experience/request you might consider looking at other tent companies ( I am hopeful MSR will get back to me). Thank you
review.name: Tent fly deamination/lost water repellence

review.reviewBody: Super light, but spacious. Clearly, a well designed tent that has stood up to bad storms with no issues thus far.
review.name: Very light for a 4-person tent

review.reviewBody: I need to purchase a new rain fly. I have tried to contact them thru customer support and no one responds. Very disappointed.
review.name: No support

review.reviewBody: Bought it and immediately took it on a backpacking trip. There were some minor leaks in the tent from a mild rain storm, and a whole lot of condensation too. I expected more out of this brand, and frankly, what i paid for it too. I'm hoping that it's better than this cause I've always liked this brand.
review.name: Good....for the most part

review.reviewBody: During a very light rainfall, the water dripped through the rain fly.
review.name: Leaked like a sieve

review.reviewBody: In my previous review, I complained about a leaking rainfly that subsequently ripped in two places. The warranty/repair service contacted me two weeks later and offered 3 solutions : replacing the defective pannels, buying a new rainfly or sending me a list of places that could repair the rainfly in Canada. The costs of the first two solutions were reasonable and we opted for buying a new rainfly. Although the problem with the rainfly was frustrating (my score for the tent is still 2 stars), I feel that the warranty/repair service was efficient and compassionate. The proposed solutions seemed fair to me.
review.name: Up date on my 08-20-22 review

review.reviewBody: We bought the tent a few years ago. Last weekend was the first time we used it in the rain. It started sprinkling lightly and you could see the water just dripping right through the fly and then right through the screen. The coating on the fly has flaked off. We packed up and left. If we were farther out in the woods or if it were really pouring, we would have been in a jam. It was very disappointing.
review.name: Fly leaked

name: Elixir Tent: 4-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice cozy jacket and very smart design. Like the thoughtful pockets.
review.name: Nice ski jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I heard good things about Marmot and gave it a try. The material is great quality. I don’t have to worry about grabbing many layers as this jacket protects me from cold and also rain. I am 5”2 and ordered small. I still find the jacket is a bit too big for me. The length of sleeves is too long but I tighten the sleeves at my wrist. Love the color. It’s unique!
review.name: My first Marmot. Very impressed!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is so amazing especially for the price! SO many pockets + the much needed pit vents. The powder skirt is meh plus after the fist 20 mins I pretty much unzip everything. Even so, it keeps me dry for the most part. The velcro over wrist is amazing. It is lightly insulated, so it doesn't exactly keep you warm in cold weather if you're thinking about using this as going out jacket like for light hiking activities or such BUT for snowboarding it's great because you don't get too hot. Highly recommend.
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for my daughter, excellent quality! We all love it!
review.name: excellent quality

review.reviewBody: Great fit and look. Love the Port Royal color. Goes with many color pants, navy Slopestar is my favorite combo and black of course.
review.name: Lots of Marmot in my closet!

name: Refuge Insulated Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought the size based on the provided sizing guide. They turned out to be longer than hoped. I like the pants and will probably have to get them tailored shorter
review.name: Sizing
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice, light weight pant great for skiing or boarding.  The color is great.
review.name: Excellent pant for the price.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like your shell jacket and pants. It is lightweight and functional. I was a bit uneasy about the hood that I never use. It turned out that it stays behind the helmet and you do not know that it is there even on a very fast run. You must have tested this configuration.  The zippers are in the right places to provide venting. The liner gives it a comfortable feel.
review.name: recommended

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like all Marmot items, it’s excellent quality and fits great. I’m 5’9” 162 lbs and wear a medium. I skied 3 days, two days with temperatures in the 50s and one day in the teens and the pants were great. Not too hot in the warm temps and with one base layer underneath, was plenty warm with the temps in the teens.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: Great pants. Got these on sale and couldn’t be happier.  Been using them for resort skiing and have kept me comfortable in all conditions.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Seems like it will be great for 30-40 degree days. Mid weight pants
review.name: Great mid weight

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these bc needed new ski pants. Price was great (on sale). When they arrived, seemed a little baggy, but once I had all my gear on they felt great. Comfy and light. Actually thought about ordering another pair as a backup or just to have years from now when they wear out. 
5’9, 180, Medium fits the waist great. Maybe an inch longer than needed, but with ski boats don’t really notice.
review.name: Good, lightweight, practical

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm as anything ever worn....work at ski resort and they are a must
review.name: Get em now

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Second pair of these pants, fit well, not too baggy for thinner legs.  Good wind protection and plenty of room to layer underneath for colder days.  Love this color also.
review.name: 2nd pair

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these pants for my teenaged son, size is right on, he's 5'7" and 140 lbs; we like the velcro adjustments at the waist and the weight and warmth seems good. (haven't used them yet). They aren't made as sturdy as they used to make them, but I'm hoping they hold up for at least a season or til he outgrows them whichever comes first.
review.name: Very good ski/snowboard pants.

name: Refuge Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I work at a farm and decided to invest in good quality shoes. Honestly, such a comfortable shoe, very supportive and does very well keeping water out. I love them and will keep buying these.
review.name: Most comfortable shoe ive ever owned

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these boots about 3 weeks ago.  Very comfortable from day one.  However, they are advertised as being waterproof and they are not at all.  Walking thru tall grass, the top of my socks were very wet.  Disappointed as I was looking for waterproof!!
review.name: UltraDry they are not!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have a slightly older model of these but i can honestly say I’ve never had a better boot. Ive had my pair for over 4 years putting untold miles on them doing trail work in Vermont, walking on slippery logs and rocks creeks in the woods for a whole season, and hiking often as well. These boots stick where you put them and keep you there. Excellent ankle and arch support which doesn’t feel constrictive. Breathable and pretty darn water resistant. Oh and they are still going and look like they have years to go. These shoes really help me do my job, I cannot recommend them enough.
review.name: Ultimate hiking boot for field tech work
comment: We are happy to hear that our Talus line has been providing you with reliable comfort, support, and durability over the years! Thank you for the wonderful review. Happy hiking!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Replaced an older pair. No break-in period. Waterproof and breathable. Good in winter and summer.
review.name: Vasque 7385
comment: We are glad to hear that your new pair required no break in process! Thank you for leaving us this review and for supporting our brand!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had these Vasque talus for 7 years.  I hike almost every day, and calculated that my old German Shepherd dog and I have walked enough miles to cross the USA.  The tread on the bottom was finally smoothed out, so I had to throw then away, but it made me so sad, I kept  the laces for sentimental reasons.
review.name: Walked across USA in these!
comment: Thank you for your review and the bonus pup picture!  For future reference, most of our Vasque styles can be resoled and we would recommend reaching out to www.davepagecobbler.com for more information on the process.

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I decided to randomly try this brand and to my surprised they were comfy right off the bat. For reference I have a narrow foot and low arch. I bought them, didn’t break them in at all, and hiked 30 miles in 3 days without ANY issue. Probably about 40-50 miles in one of the shoe lace holders broke. These boots were used in Michigan, Oregon, Vermont, New Hampshire, Maine, Wisconsin, and all throughout Minnesota. I just got back from a 16 mile hiking trip in two days and I have blisters on my big toe. I had the worst foot and joint (hips and knees) pain I have ever had while hiking. In a little over two years of me having them I put about 130-140 miles on them (based on my Apple Watch tracker which I have found to be more accurate than my hiking partners watches she’s had over the years). With a quick google search many references state a good pair should last you 500-900 miles or 10 miles each week for a year. But none the less these were great boots for the most part. I did at lot of hiking on pretty tough terrain so that definitely can play a role but who knows. I mainly also do all my hiking in spring and fall. All I know is I think it’s time to retire these and try something new after all that pain. All in all they are great for your average hiking person with a narrow foot.
review.name: 2 years and 130-140 miles later here’s my opinion
comment: Thank you for your review. We are sorry that our Vasque boots did not fully live up to your expectations, but I am happy to hear the overall feel and specifications of your boots are held up well. We hope to serve you again in the future!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These were my first real hiking boots when I was 18 and I wore them for years. I love the Vibram sole and the support at the ankle. the grip is amazing! The only problem I have it that my feet grew!!! I'm an 11.5 or 12 now and they are just too tight (although I wore them for a year after realizing and I STILL didn't get any blisters and my feet were almost comfortable). If these shoes are ever made in a larger size I would buy them in a heartbeat.
review.name: Please make an 11.5/12!!!!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair of vasque talus from scheels in 2020. I've done miles and miles of hiking in Rocky mountain national, Aspen, glacier National, Yellowstone, grand tetons, and just on the trails in wisconsin for the last 3 years and they're still in great shape! Here to buy a second pair to have ready to go just in case especially with a trip to the national parks in Utah and Arizona coming up. They are true to size (I'm usually a 9.5 and that's what fit), keeps my foot and ankle stable, and keep my square toes comfortable without pinching them
review.name: Best hiking boots
comment: It's great to hear about the performance of the Talus! We are glad to hear we have lived up to your expectations with the design. We hope to do business with you again in the future.  Be safe out there!

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: We purchase these vasque boots years ago, but had not used them until recently. After walking 10 miles up an incline totally 250 feet, the soles fell off both boots.
review.name: Sole fell off hiking 10 mi; older barely used.
comment: Hi, I am sorry to hear about the soles falling off. I have sent you an email and will help you out to the best of my ability to get you back out hiking.

review.itemreviewed: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these boots in January 2022, started wearing them in April, nevertheless, the rubber toe protector is too small, it should overlap a little bit more on the toes because  it wears too fast. I have not used them extensively and as of July, the rubber part started to lift. I think it is a design problem.  Otherwise, they are confortable, waterproof, but the sole could be more gripping. I recommend that you extend the rubber part and they would be perfect!
I don't know if they are still under warranty but if yes, I would like another pair!!!
review.name: Problem with the toe protector

name: Talus AT UltraDry Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Used this product on a birding  trip in the Andes. Needed a lightweight water container because we are at very high altitudes and couldn’t afford much weight in my pack since I’m a flatlander and every ounce added to my perpetual shortness of breath
review.name: Worked well on a trip in the high Andes in Ecuador

review.reviewBody: I bought this bottle for convenience when travelling, and it was impossible to open the flip top.  I had to unscrew the lid in order to drink.  I miss the platypus even though it was more fragile. It is also very expensive if you can't actually open it.
review.name: Flip top lid too tight.
comment:
Thank you for the feedback, we appreciate it! We can gladly replace your Flux cap under our warranty program, since it is not functioning as intended.
Please file a claim here:
https://support.hydrapak.com/hc/en-us

After you have filed a claim, we will respond to your ticket very quickly, usually within 1-2 days.

Thank you!

review.reviewBody: Great travel bottle. This bottle conveniently fits in water bottle sleeves or packs down and stores away while traveling. I really enjoy how it holds it shape when not full of water. I have taken this bottle on a handful of trips out of state and flown with it. Defiantly a great bottle to take with you on vacations and hiking.
review.name: Lightweight and packable.

review.reviewBody: I use the bottle every day, both at work and on trips. It is very convenient to hold in the hand, when folded it takes up very little space. I wanted to complete the flask with a plug-n-play cap and a hydra flex tube, but unfortunately there is no place to buy them in Ukraine:((. The photo was taken in Ukraine, with Lake Nesamovyte in the background
review.name: Perfect flask

review.reviewBody: Bought two Patagonia capilene hoodies to wear while hiking in the hot New Mexico sun. They are so lightweight and keep me cool and protected in the burning hot sun. I am small framed , 5.5 and weigh around 120 and the small fits fine
review.name: Love my Hoodies!

review.reviewBody: This was perfect for a super sunny river rafting trip. My only suggested improvement would be a small zipper pocket to store my chapstick!
review.name: Great for river rafting

review.reviewBody: I bought the shirt midway through the PCT to replace my Crater Lake Sun hoodie that started to wear thin after 3 months. This was a great option at first glance. Good quality, well made. However it was twice the weight and thickness of the Crater Lake And I was disappointed that there were no thumb holes to cover hands on the trail. The fit was true to size, it was nice because it didn't have any drawstrings or pockets to get in the way of the hip belt on my pack. I did return it though because it was just too thick and warm for summer hiking. Might be a good option for fall or early spring.
review.name: Nice quality shirt,  bit too heavyweight

review.reviewBody: I love the Patagonia Capilene Cool Daily Hoodie.  I bought my first for the Camino de Santiago and fell in love with it.  I recently purchased my second through Backcountry where I found a great deal and a gorgeous color - Wispy Green. The hoodie is very light weight and while it's perfect for sun protection on warm days, it's also great for layering on cooler days. It also looks nice for traveling and walking around town.  It's one of my go-to shirts!
review.name: Perfect for the Camino de Santiago!

review.reviewBody: This is everything that I've been looking for in a sun hoodie. It is impossibly thin which is perfect for me because I want to wear it in the summer when the sun is strong for UV protection. I'm actually not sure how effective it is when it comes to UV protection so I still apply sunscreen on underneath. But I do love how breathable the fabric is and how soft it feels. I've worn it all day outdoor rock climbing in the high 80Fs, on a challenging 8mi hike around 80F (pictured below), and just for running errands. The best part is I got this when it was on sale and it was such a steal! I'm usually in between a small and medium and I got a medium in Pumice (oatmeal color). My only complaint is that there are no thumbholes but that's just me nitpicking.
review.name: Obsessed!

review.reviewBody: I have four of these Patagonia hoodies: Gray, green, coral, and blue. They are just the right outfit for warm weather, when I am out and about in the sun. When it's windy I just put up the hood.
review.name: Cool and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I'm a big fan of this hoodie! Its really lightweight and feels cool in hot weather. The size Small fits me perfectly (I'm usually a Small/4 at 5'3" and an athletic 130 lbs). I plan on hiking in this, and layering it with a short sleeve tech t and a lightweight vest as the weather gets cooler!
review.name: Light and cooling

review.reviewBody: I have been eyeing a sun hoodie for a long time and pulled the trigger on the Patagonia Capilene Cool Daily Hoodie since I have the t shirt version and loved the Iggy Blue color. I sometimes struggle with the t shirt version being a little stiff so I was skeptical of how this top would feel. WOW- I immediately I took it out of the package and slipped it on and it felt like silk. It is so soft, so light, and drapes really nice on my body. I am pleasantly surprised with this top. I was worried it would be a little steamy on a summer hike but it felt cooler than a regular athletic t shirt I would normally wear. Can't wait to put this through the ringer this summer and into the fall!
review.name: Wow- Pleasently Surprised!

review.reviewBody:
Bought this for my wife after she started commenting on how often I wear them. She's officially converted too. These are great for SUP'ing or any boating trips, summer camping, biking, etc. Light and cool!

*The size measurements are hers
review.name: 5 Stars

review.reviewBody: Super comfy, incredibly lightweight material. I was looking for a casual lightweight shirt for cooler temp mountain biking. My husband says he can wear his comfortably between 65 and 85 degrees. I got a medium for a somewhat loose fit.
review.name: Husband loved them, so I got one

name: Capilene Cool Daily Hoodie - Women's
