review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love it. My husband wears them to work on his cars. The bib can take anything he throws at them in the garage. Great buy. Thx.
review.name: Love the bib!

review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit.  Thick sturdy material. Love the color.
review.name: Great quality.

review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this as a gift for my grandson, who put it on as soon as he received it Christmas Day. The very first time he tried to buckle the straps, one buckle completely came off as it was not secured well enough at the metal joint. We had to find tools to completely pry apart the metal, put the strap back together, and then use pliers to compress the metal back together to hold the strap in a loop position so it could be buckled. Not something we should've had to do the very first day of use, or at all for that matter. Very disappointed in the quality of an expensive, namebrand product
review.name: Poor workmanship

review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Grandson liked it. Put them on soon as he opened them. Look good on him.

review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wanted to return an item because it doesn't fit, but no one at Carhatt helped. Should rename the brand to Canthalp

review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Falling apart. Pockets are ripping, the elastic is torn on one side. I've worn them 3 times each time with a jacket over them so they can't be getting ripped up at work. Way to expensive for them to be this fragile.
review.name: Expensive pretend work wear

review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got my husband and son matching coveralls and they're both insanely great quality. My husband loves how many pockets there are, and he's already worked on the jeeps many times in them, and not a single rip or anything has happened yet! Great quality, great look, very comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: The quality of Carhartt is obvious in every product. I get compliments and inquiries about them every where I go. These are forever.
review.name: The Test of Time

review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: The overalls are very durable and comfortable. They fit well.
review.name: Outstanding overalls

review.itemreviewed: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I gave this a 4 star because the general appearance and fit was great but the metal piece of the adjustable straps has a clamp that holds the elastic band and it gave out upon the first adjustment. I want really pulling all that hard, or at least I thought. Luckily I have some technical/mechanical know how and was able to pry the clip open, fit the elastic band in and clamp it back down with pliers and fix the adjuster?? but I shouldn't have had to do all that. Please consider an alternative in the manufacturing process.
review.name: Good, but could be better.

name: R01 Duck Bib Overall Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is my go-to beanie - I have three now. It fits my sort of larger head really well (not too tight so my hair isn't irreparably smashed when I take it off), it's flattering, the fabric is soft (not at all itchy), warm, breathable and washes well. The colors I have are really pretty and it's essentially all I could want in a winter hat.
review.name: The perfect hat!

review.reviewBody: Runs large. I often buy one-size beanie that end being too small for me. I bought a small and a large. The small fits me comfortably, even loose. The large is huge! The synthetic fabric is not soft at all; feels cheap. Color is as advertised.
review.name: runs large; fabric not soft

review.reviewBody:
Replacing an old Patagonia hat I?ve had for a few years. Super warm and comfy- sometimes a little too warm.

Sizing: I wear a 7-3/8 fitted hat and the s/m fit was perfect. I thought my big head would have needed a l/xl so I initially bought that size and had to return - backcountry gear heads were awesome flipping the right size around at no charge!
review.name: Warm and fits great!

name: Better Sweater Beanie

review.reviewBody: These boots fit great and are incredibly comfortable and warm. The downside is that the  traction in snow/ice is pretty horrible which is disappointing for an “all terrain” winter boot with a Vibram sole. I’ve already had a few hard falls in less than a month of wearing these. Save a few bucks and get the original thermal boots, looks like they’d have better traction.
review.name: Decent

review.reviewBody:
I bought this coat against my better judgement after reading some negative reviews. I thought I could be careful and wash it according to the tag instructions and my experience would be better … WRONG! 

I wore this coat ~ 6 times and washed it according to instructions. My coat was so messed up from just the one washing. The down all balled up and made it look like my coat had tumors. It was really gross. Do not buy this coat!! You’ll be sorry! I had to fight to get Backcountry to accept my return. This was a swing and complete miss by OR, don’t waste your money.
review.name: TERRIBLE quality- buyer beware!!!

review.reviewBody: I love it so much! The fit is exactly what I was looking for - cute and boxy, but not too cropped. The fabric and down fill is SUPER soft. I got in the oyster color which is even better in person than online shots - feels very elevated. Even though this may not be the "most waterproof", I can confirm it is highly water resistant. It kept me dry and warm during a rainy PNW day, even after a car splashed me w a puddle! The (dirty) water bounced right off leaving no trace behind - which was such a relief considering the color of the coat. All in all this piece exceeded my expectations SO much so that I felt compelled to share with whoever will listen ;-)
review.name: Couldn't Be Happier!

review.reviewBody: Haven’t had a chance to try it out in really cold weather yet ,but it is a quality jacket. It is a roomy fit, I got my usual size large and I will definitely be able to layer under it. I love the bright red color. For the sale price this was a steal!
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought the white one a few months back. It was 700 FII and the price was great . It was warm without being bulky and I enjoyed wearing it. BUT it did not was well. Instructions were followed (I washed two Patagonia jackets too and they are fine). The down has detached and bunched in places so there is no insulation in some parts of the jacket. I'm quite disappointed and bummed. Was thinking of buying OR for my family but will not do that now.
review.name: Did not wash well

review.reviewBody: Very light weight and comfortable.
review.name: Love my Black Jacket so much - I have purchased it in Yellow

review.reviewBody: My husband bought the bright green one for me, and I love it so much! It's very soft and lightweight, but soooo warm. I walk the dog in it when it's cold and windy outside, and I can't feel the wind through it at all. The color is a fun switch from the usual black or grey puffers. I'm a size 14-16, and the XL is roomy but not shapeless on me.
review.name: So warm!

review.reviewBody: Bought this last month love the jacket warm and love the inner thumb holes but wish I had read that it runs big
review.name: Love the jacket warm

review.reviewBody: I am super picky about my outerwear and have been eyeing this jacket for a while.  I got it in the yellow sized medium and it is just what i wanted.  The fit is perfect.  I'm 5'5 and 130lb and it gives me a little room to move but doesn't look overwhelming.  It is warm and comfortable.  It was the coat that I chose to take on a trip to Europe to wear everyday in a bunch of different weather conditions.  I layered in with a shell on top when it was pouring rain - thanks climate change :(   And the yellow is fun and gets tons of compliments.  This one is a winner.
review.name: The bomb!

review.reviewBody: I love the Coldfront Down jackets that OR has been putting out recently. (So much so, I own two different styles.) This jacket specifically combines my top two necessities, warmth and functionality, without sacrificing style. I can wear this to the office, around the winter bonfire, or for a night out on the town. Been recommending this to friends who want a comfortable, warm, and good looking down jacket.
review.name: Warmth without sacrifice

review.reviewBody: Very warm and also waterproof I believe... Keeps me warm and is much nicer than all the other people I see skiing with jackets...
review.name: Very good looking jacket

review.reviewBody: This boot is beautiful! The leather is thick and beautifully stitched together-even the tongue is made out of thick pink leather! The inside is my favorite as the insole is softer than my husbands Red Wings but is still quality and sturdy, not like other brands that use women for an excuse to cheap out on material. It even has pink laces! I’m surprised this wasn’t like a special edition boot for twice the price.This boot makes me want to visit Red Wing, Minnesota
review.name: In love with Red Wing quality and innovation!❤️

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it, super cute and cozy. Baby sleeps well in it.
review.name: Love it, super cute and

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love my classic redwing moc boot. This is my 2nd pair and they are totally worth the investment.
review.name: Classic redwing moc boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the perfect wearable blanket for warm summer nights. Lightweight but still provides comfort.
review.name: Great Summer wearable blanket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely love the soft lightweight and 100% cotton fabric, durable zipper, and cute patterns. We will buy again and again! They are so easy to use and we love that they zip up from the bottom to make diaper changes easier. 10/10 recommend.
review.name: Favorite sleep sack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We love these sleep sacks! We received the swaddle version in a sampler box, and it quickly became our go-to. It was so easy to transition her directly into these sleep sacks from the swaddles. I love that they’re light and breathable but also a solid blanket to keep her warm. High quality and can withstand lots of post-blowout washings. Also cute patterns. We’ll be using these in every size until she outgrows sleep sacks altogether
review.name: The only sleep sack I’ll use

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The sleep sacks are very soft and comfy, easy to wear and wash
review.name: Very comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We love this sleep sack! It’s light weight and perfect for naps and nighttime wear.
review.name: Lovely Sleep Sack

review.reviewBody: These boots are narrow. Real tight though. The laces are short too. Could be longer.
review.name: Shoes
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you, minus the rough break in period. We will send your comments and suggestions over to the Product/ Design Team to let them know to see if we can make updates to this model. We hope to serve you again in the future.

review.reviewBody: After a few wearing with a loose heel, these are now perfect for almost everything I do. They're comfortable, lightweight and oozing with timeless style. As they age and weather, I love them even more.
review.name: Wow. My new favorite pair of shoes
comment: Hello, we are so glad to hear that you're falling more in love with our Women's Oro Moc Toe every day and with every wear. We couldn't agree more that even as they weather and age, they get more beautiful. Thank you for your heartfelt review. We hope your timeless boots last for many years and many wonderful memories for you!

name: Classic Moc 6in Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: I changed from a road bike to a gravel bike in order to take advantage of the more relaxed position (I’m getting older). It definitely helped but I was not totally happy with the bike. These tires changed my bike into everything I hoped it to be. It’s smooth and fast. I had lost over a half a mile an hour, but now it’s back. They grip well and roll fast. Secure on corners and comfortable to ride on. Using the right tires can certainly change your bike. These tires are exceptional in my opinion and for my needs.
review.name: Totally changed my bike for the better

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: Great for rough roads, light gravel, or messy winter and early spring conditions. More traction than a road tire but still rolls pretty quickly.
review.name: When you need more than a road tire

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
I've only got a few hundred miles on these tires. I paired them up with my brand-new Boyd Kanuga wheelset. The Terreno Zeros seem pretty stout. They feel thick and sticky but they also feel a little slow. Hard to believe my old Mezcals feel faster to me. This could be due to the wheelset as well. That being said, I love Vittoria tires. I don't ride anything else anymore but I think I'm going to try the regular Terrano Dry's next time and skip this one with the center slick. 

I'm riding a lot of road and double track fire roads so I went with this as an experiment. Don't get me wrong, I like 'em a lot. Just not for the money I spent. I am curious how long they will last.
review.name: Love Vittoria...but the jury's still out

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
This is my go-to gravel race tire for dry conditions. The slick center and fish scale shoulders are perfect for gravel racing. Super fast when it needs to be and enough grip in the turns without adding resistance that big knobs do. Raced it on super fast hard pack, deep sand, chunky gravel, slabs of rock, moon dust, and everything in between. 

I've started running the Vittoria insert and with the lower pressure that allows me they are super comfy. 

If you are not a good bike handler you may need to look at a tire with more tread.
review.name: Elite Grave RACE Tire

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
I bought 4 of these tires.  2 from Competitive Cyclist and 2 from Backcountry.  700x35.  Both times when they were $30 on sale.  The 2 from CC went on friend's Trek Checkpoint and mounted on Bontrager wheels.  One of the wheels required a bontrager strip but otherwise the tubeless hold and my friend seems to be happy.

The second set, however, has had some issues.  They mounted just fine on  Stan's grails with stans tape and tubeless valve.  Once seated, they seemed to seal, however, the rear tire just won't hold air for more than a day.  Sometime front loses it too, but seems more stable.  The rear will go completely flat within a day or 2.  I have put the tire into bathtub and there are bubbles all along both sidewalls, lots of bubbles.  I have added more sealant and even had tire on it's side, then on another one, and that held for few rides, then it started losing it again.  So 1 out of 4 tires seems to be defective.  

I don't like making warranty claims so I may play with different sealant or just tube it and call it good until it's done.  But for my new set, I will go back to Panaracer which has proven it's mettle when it comes to tubeless.
review.name: Tubeless quality may vary

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
Very challenging to mount. These look great with super nice volume. Roll nicely. Probably a great tire if planning to use on-road only. On gravel, I find the tread to be really lacking. I know this is the 'zero' model, so I don't expect it to perform in heavy gravel, or technical double track, but even on mild gravel roads, the traction is very unpredictable. Had my first gravel slideout/crash in many years when I pushed these tires in a turn. My fault for pushing them too fast through a corner, but my complaint is how fast they lose traction with no hint or warning. Most tires you'll feel starting to break traction and you have a fraction of a second to react ... not these. It was upright one instant, on the ground the next. 

Also find that they cut extremely easily. Backside of my seat tube is a gooey, sticky mess from the frequent cuts and subsequent sealant spraying. Really disappointed as I wanted to keep these on the bike. Just happy I got them on sale.
review.name: disappointing

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: I used this tire on my commuter rig inflated to 50PSI, which is a bit higher than you'd inflate for performance applications, but less than the max pressure. During one of my commutes the tire blew off the sidewall in the middle of a corner causing me to crash.
review.name: Prone to blowouts

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: I have the 38mm but they are labeled as 40 and measure 41 on an inner width 25mm.  They set up a little square but were simple to set up on WTB frequency KOM rims and hold their air really good even in Michigan winters.  They are really fast and hold their footing pretty good even standing on dirt roads.  I would highly recommend.  No flats in about 500 miles>
review.name: Fast and durable Tires

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
PLEASE NOTE: THE SIDEWALL SAYS "HOOKED RIM ONLY"

I bought to mount on a set of Enve rims, not compatible.
review.name: Hooked Rim Only
comment: If you mounted a tire that is not designed to be on a hookless rim on a hookless rim like Enve don't complain when you eventually make an unplanned trip to the hospital and your dentist at some point. Vittoria did not label them, "Hooked Rims Only" just for the fun of it. =)
I went ahead and mounted them on my enve SES AR 3.4 and they are holding just fine.

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
I bought these last year and put them on my Scott Scale MTB. My riding is 90% paved trails, 10% hardpack dirt or gravel roads. I run the pressure at about 75 psi letting them get down to maybe 50 before I fill them up again. Last year I rode about 1100 miles and had not flats. This years I've had 4 flats all within the last month. As I look closely at the tire tread I can see multiple small slices and several tiny holes. Two of the flats were caused by pokes through the tire from what I guess was wire. Two flats were caused by tiny but very sharp pointed stones.

The tight bead on these tires made getting them off my rims challenging. Getting them back on was not difficult at all.

I really don't know if 2000 miles is great, average or so-so but I feel that 2000 miles on a set of tires is pretty darn good despite the flats. Maybe my luck will change with a new set of tires. That's why I've ordered them again. They ride well, are quiet and for my type of riding, a good choice.
review.name: 2000 miles during which I got 4 flats

name: Terreno Zero G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire

hasVariant.name: Neve Pro Crampons
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Neve Pro Crampons online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great crampons, super lightweight. The updated lock for the heel is easy to use compared to older models. And they look really sweet.
review.name: Very light, very packable

review.reviewBody: Super light. Unfortunately, doesn't fit/work well with 2 of the 3 boots I use other crampons with. Best to try them out in-person with boots you intend to use them with. While all the accessories do, indeed, broaden the crampons' ability to work with different boots, it feels like Black Diamond is nickle-and-diming us for some basic flexibility that is built in to other crampons (different size cables, toe harness, heel straps, bails)... and these extras are pricey!
review.name: Neve crampons

review.reviewBody: These are a great fit for both my duckbill telemark boots as well as my summit pro AT setup.  Easy on/easy off.  I can't compare them to other models, but I was absolutely amazed at how light, agile, efficient, and dependable a boot crampon could be.
review.name: First Boot Crampons

review.reviewBody: I bought the Neve crampon for my Tecnica Cochise touring ski boots, and they fit perfect and are exactly what I was looking for ski mountaineering. Ultra light, and durable. The capable connector is flexible but holds up to repeated bending. The heal level has adjustability that helps dial in a precise and tight fit. Excellent product, thank you BD!
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: Good choice if bumping between different boots. These do exactly what you want once setup properly. If I bought again for my purpose I would go with the pros.
review.name: They'll keep you on the mountainside

review.reviewBody: Should you need lightweight skimo crampons, consider that included toe bail doesn't give a snug fit to ski boots. Wide toe bail could do the work; however, it is not available anywhere globally...
review.name: Doesn't fit ski mountaineering boots

review.reviewBody: Used them once so far. Really light and easy to use.
review.name: Used them once so far.

review.reviewBody: Light weight and easily adjustable. Great glacier crampon
review.name: Great light weight glacier crampon

name: Neve Pro Crampons

review.reviewBody: I really love them! I use them for indoor bouldering and top roping. I had trouble figuring out my perfect size but once I did, they fit like a glove! I wear a size 8 in street shoes and a size 9.5 in my mythos.
review.name: Perfect for me

review.reviewBody: I've climbed in these shoes and their predecessors (the purple one and the minty green ones) for decades. They really fit my feet well, and I've been willing to tolerate the la sportiva rubber (not my fav) until it's time for a resole and I can get something stickier. Unfortunately,  the rubber on the eco is an order of magnitude worse than the old mythos. Even more unfortunately, when I've had the shoes re-soled they delaminate in the mid foot between the lining and the sole so that the shoe bubbles up uncomfortably in in your forefoot. This has happened with two different  pairs at two different resolers (both with excellent reputations), and the resolers say that this is a known problem for them. So as much as I love the fit of these shoes I can’t justify tossing them every six months when it is time to resole, especially when the native rubber is so bad.
review.name: Not what they used to be, alas.

review.reviewBody:
Pretty upset with the durability of the Eco leather. I bought a brand new pair before my trip to Indian Creek to do some crack climbing for a week and the sand stone ate four lace loops and shredded the laces. I get that crack climbing if rough on shoes but I was three days in my trip with a brand new pair.

They are still grate shoes for face climbing and the gym but I can say the same for rugged Trad anymore. The shoes are practically useless till I find a way to fix the lace loops.
review.name: The Creek ate your new shoe.

review.reviewBody:
I love the way they feel! Way comfier than other brands. I’m a beginner and I wear a size 9- I bought a size 9/40.5
But I want to change the laces to purple- can you tell me how long these laces are??
review.name: How long are the shoe laces?

review.reviewBody: Love these so much, didn’t take long for the leather to form to my feet, they now feel like they were custom made for my feet.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: This is the best trad climbing shoe - every few years, i buy a new pair. Not too tight, not too loose, works excellent for a whole day of multipitch climbs and torqueing your feet into cracks, and still works for finicky face climbing. They stretch a tad, so whatever fits snug but not painful, maybe 1/2 size less... i am also a huge fan of la sportiva viabram rubber, nice and sticky. If your not sure what climbing shoe, but multipitch trad climbing is your thing, this is the shoe!
review.name: The best women's trad climbing shoe!!!

review.reviewBody: I’m am happily buying my second pair. I’ve found for any climb up to 11a slab these shoes have great sticky rubber and an edge that stays.
review.name: Second pair

review.reviewBody:
A re-edition of the famous Mythos climbing shoe, made for its 95% with eco-friendly materials to minimize the environmental
impact. It is the versatile shoe par excellence, suitable for long routes thanks to the exceptionally comfortable fit.
review.name: La Sportiva Mythos selling features

review.reviewBody:
Quality of the leather and laces(!) on these shoes are far below my other pair of original Mythos.
I’m disappointed :(

I hope they withstand two weeks of training until I find another pair.
review.name: Disgusting Quality

review.reviewBody: The very first day I wore these the laces completely ripped and tore. I only climbed a couple single pitch cracks! I know another girl with these shoes and they are beyond shredded! I don't climb hard enough to have this concern, and neither does my friend whose toes poke out of her shoe (she has only owned them a few months and doesn't climb weekly)! These shoes are not made for crack climbing of any sorts. don't waste your money
review.name: NOT ABRASION RESISTENT

name: Mythos Eco Climbing Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Friend indeed!  I am so happy with the Rafiki as a Powder ski. It is poppy and playful with a reliable turn that still allows you to float in a heavenly way through 2 inches of cream or 2 feet of fluff.  The design is buoyant and "surfy" but I still felt stable when landing on a cat track or a groomer- just keeping me on my toes.  Overall if you are looking to add a TRUE powder ski to your quiver this is an "always friends on powder day" addition.
review.name: Best Friends on a Powder Day

review.reviewBody: This is the best pow ski I've ever had! She makes the funnest surfy turns and will float through anything but can still hold her own on groomers too! If you're looking for a pow ski that you can still rip around on the hardpack this is the ski for you!
review.name: Surfy Pow Turns

review.reviewBody: This was not as pictured. In the picture, the shiny side is on the outside and the fleece is on the inside. I talked to someone and had them look at the specifications. They said that the picture matched the specs and that the glossy side was on the outside. So, I returned the item for a replacement. The replacement has the fleece on the outside and the shiny side on the inside. I live in an area with wet snow, which would work better with shiny side out.
review.name: Not as pictured

review.reviewBody: I love it, keeps my baby warm, when outside gets compliments.
review.name: Worth the money

review.reviewBody: Keeps my kid very warm and he feels very comfortable inside. 5/5
review.name: Yes would buy again and again

review.reviewBody: Feels warm, and I love the mitten cuffs & feet cuffs.
review.name: I would definitely it this product again

review.reviewBody: It's soooo cute on my baby however I thought it was going to be on the heavier side especially for the price tag.
review.name: Pricey

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We used this for our 1yr old, she just turned in December. It works well to just grab and go shopping with her or flip the feet open and put her boots on.
review.name: Perfect for our 1yr old

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super warm for my little explorer! Stayed dry too. Great for outdoor winter adventures.
review.name: Winter must have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect extra warm coat and does not buldge in car seat or stroller.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Product fits great; very warm for the baby and love the fact that the hood is warm and cozy too!
review.name: Great product for baby!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Keeps baby warm and dry. Easy to get on and not too bulky so baby can move and walk easily. I sized up to 24 months for my 15 month old and will definitely be able to use next season. Love that it has the fold over mittens on all sizes. When we don't need the mittens the cuffs roll up nicely and stay off baby's hands. Great buy, highly recommend!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd pair in less than 6 months. They are perfect my treadmill so one pair is devoted to just that. So comfy!
review.name: Highly Recommend

review.reviewBody: I use it in my daily walking and my foot won't get tired easily. I also like the design and the way the tie is easy to fold no need to cross tied.. I bought another one for my wife because she likes it also.
review.name: Great design and comfortable for walking

review.reviewBody: I had to break the shoes in 1-2 shifts before they fully felt comfy for my feet. after that they're my favorite pair of shoes to grab for any occasion where ill be walking for a while. they work great on my 12 hour shifts as a RN. I cant compare them to the cleftons since this is my first hoka pair. fit great, didnt even try them on before ordering online.
review.name: First hokas, quite comfy

review.reviewBody: I have never wanted any Hokas because of the unattractive, thick sole. However, these soles are not as thick and look more feminine. The support maybe slightly less than the thick soled Frankenstein styles, but way better than my On Clouds. I love the Solimar shoe, and it didn't let me down on comfort when I stood in line for four hours to get into a Trump rally! Ask for the size I am normally a nine, but I had to get a 9 1/2. And my foot is narrow and the width was perfect for me. It is not often that I am able to find a shoe that is not too wide.
review.name: Pleasantly surprised!

review.reviewBody: These are great shoes, they are true to size and are extremely comfortable. My only complaint is they are lighter in person then what is imaged, that's not a huge problem other then they will look dirtier quicker since they are my shoes for crossfit.
review.name: Amazing Fit Great Lighter In Person

review.reviewBody: I am a nurse who lives in her feet at work. I used to have to take prescription pain medication related to my arthritis and the line of work I'm in around the clock on the days when I work and the whole next day. On my first day of wearing these Hokas, I didn't have lower back pain! This repeated on day two. I've since had an annual checkup and had my dose lowered! Wow! Love my SHOES!
review.name: My FIRST bu not LAST Hokas!

review.reviewBody: I got these shoes in hopes they would help my shin splints from trail+treadmill running and I haven't gotten shin splints since. I also wear them to work, I have a job where I have to walk and carry heavy things all day long 2-3 days a week. I have really high arches, so my feet really hurt after a long day of moving around. My feet NEVER hurt at the end of the day anymore even if my legs feel like jello from exhaustion. They're really a life saver if you're on your feet all day and good for running too, though I want to buy a second pair in a different style now that I trail run more than on a treadmill.
review.name: Saved my feet and shins

review.reviewBody: I've worn 4 pairs of hokas. I'm a women's 8 wide. The solimar wide is more narrow than Rincon 3 . I can feel it squuzing my foot. Other models were not this narrow. and when I put them up to each other to compare its about 1 cm narrower. Hoka ...who did the sizing here?? I'm likely to return these. Great color but when I order wide I want wide. Very dissatisfied with this!!
review.name: Wide is more narrow than previous models

review.reviewBody: I have had several Hoka sneakers but these feel so comfortable and not quite so high in cushioning, so not catching my toe on the floor.
review.name: Extremely Comfortable and Lightweight

review.reviewBody: This shoe has excellent support for both casual walking and working out at the gym. Gives me just the right amount of support. This is my 2nd pair of Solimar/HOKA. They are excellent.
review.name: This is a great product--2nd time buying this shoe

name: Solimar Running Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Long Belfast Winter Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm 5'5" and 140lbs. Got a medium in this like everything else I own recently but it's pretty tight in the arms and chest. If you want to wear anything other than a thin sweater underneath, I'd recommend sizing up. Otherwise, great quality and keeps me warm.
review.name: Warm but small

review.itemreviewed: Long Belfast Winter Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this coat for dog walking on cold rainy days in the Northeast and have found it to be an excellent choice. I like all the fit options with Velcro wristbands and hood pulls. The medium worked best for me since I didn’t want it to fit tightly over a layer or two. I’m 5’3” 120 lbs, moderately curvy. It’s not a fashionable close fitting coat but a functional, comfortable and well engineered one.
review.name: Warm comfortable and weatherproof

review.itemreviewed: Long Belfast Winter Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great length, very cozy on a cold, rainy day but the coat runs small under the arms & across the chest. I'm 5'8", 123 lbs, not very broad-shouldered & it sits too high up in the armpit. I can only wear a thin layer beneath.
review.name: warm but tight across chest

review.itemreviewed: Long Belfast Winter Insulated Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I live in Seattle where it pours rain. I love this jacket because it?s lined and keeps me really warm, the sleeves are fitted to keep me dry and warm. The packets have zippers, so nothing falls out. It hits me at my thigh, which I like. I?m 5?2?. You won?t be disappointed with this jacket.
review.name: Excellent jacket

name: Long Belfast Winter Insulated Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Hummvee Waterproof Hooded Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Endura Hummvee Waterproof Hooded Jacket - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hummvee Waterproof Hooded Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Endura Hummvee Waterproof Hooded Jacket - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Arrived and delivered the goods. You won't be disappointed.
review.name: Tremendous Jacket

review.reviewBody:
9/20/21. This is just my initial impression, but I think this is a really well made jacket. It's not nearly as heavy as I thought it would be. The only strange thing is that it is very narrow across the underarms. I measure 41 inches around the chest and based on the size chart I should be in a large. The large is just too tight and pinches when I cross my arms. I'm going to return it and get an XL. Hopefully it isn't too big everywhere else. 

9/24/21. I decided to order an XL and keep the size that fit best. The XL definitely fits best and it fits like most brand's Large. For example, the Endura XL fits like my North Face Large. For clarity purposes, I am 5'10" tall, 175 lbs, with a 32" waist, and 41" chest. I am fit, but not heavily muscled. I mostly mountain bike and trail run, but I do lift free weights 2x per week. I hope this helps others find the right size. I'm really looking forward to riding this winter in my new jacket.

Cheers!
review.name: Awesome Jacket

name: Hummvee Waterproof Hooded Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the The North Face Base Camp Rolling Thunder 28in Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Base Camp Rolling Thunder 28in Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Base Camp Rolling Thunder 28in Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Had the old 30" hard bottom style forever. Upgraded to the new one. Love it. Would change one thing and I'm actually surprised the designers did not catch this flaw. The large exterior zipper pocket on top of the clam shell easily gets a failed zipper clasp when zipping which can be solved by having the cinch straps on top of the zipper instead of below the zipper. When you go to cinch the two straps down they pull on the zipper itself. Rather than pulling on top and put no pressure on the zipper, it pulls from under the zipper and strains the zipper itself. Design flaw that could have been easily fixed.
review.name: Love it, would change one thing

review.reviewBody: Really happy with this bag! Super sturdy and fit everything for me and my son, for a month long trip to Europe. Highly recommend.
review.name: 3rd rolling thunder purchase. Love each one!

review.reviewBody: We have an upcoming trip to Europe and needed a check bag. This bag is great in that it is about as big as you can get and still meet the size requirements to not incur airline penalties.
review.name: Should be good for years.

review.reviewBody: It's North Face STRONG!!!! Durable and functional!!!
review.name: I would buy this for EVERYONE on your gift giving list!

review.reviewBody: Love this bag so much. It's convenient and stylish. Has plenty of room for everything. The quality is on point. Now I want them all.
review.name: I will be buying more of these!

review.reviewBody: I've been Base Camp Duffel devotee for decades, but was looking for something with similar levels of durability and size that was easier to transport through airports and train stations. After 2 international trips, the construction seems excellent without any damage from baggage handlers. The design is intelligent and the compartments well thought out for carrying a wide array of gear and clothing. The wheels are large enough to go over bumps and slightly rough terrain with relative ease.
review.name: Best Roller Bag So Far

review.reviewBody: This is our third North Face suitcase. We love how rugged they are!
review.name: Great Suitcase!

review.reviewBody: This bag is a beast. It's great for a 7-10 day trip. It's rugged, reliable, and built by a great brand.
review.name: A Beast with a Belly for your Stuff

review.reviewBody: This is a high quality bag that can take a beating from even the strongest airline baggage handler. I like the sleek look in black and the strong, durable material. It has more than enough room to accommodate a long term trip. I Also purchased the same bag in 22" which has more than enough room as a carry-on. I would highly recommend this bag to anyone with a more adventurous itinerary or someone who wants a strong, stylish looking duffel for everyday travel.
review.name: Rugged and Sleek Rolling Duffel

review.reviewBody: It's my one size fits all bag...cruise-take everything I need to bag and my world birding-need waterproof gear and more bag. Sturdy, easy to pack. Easy to roll. Tough when checked in for flight or to go onboard ship. Folds down. Tucks away.
review.name: It's my one size fits all go to bag!

name: Base Camp Rolling Thunder 28in Bag
Base Camp Rolling Thunder 28in Bag

description: Buy the Fjallraven Ovik Travel Shirt - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ovik Travel Shirt - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Ovik Travel Shirt - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It was everything it promised to be. Relaxed fit. Cool in the summer heat. Great color.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: I got this shirt a couple years ago when it was the comfort fit and it's been one of my favorite shirts since. Saw that they have a new color way and decided to purchase another but didn't realize how much difference there is in sizing compared to before. If you purchased this shirt before the "improved (relaxed) fit", probably go a size down as the new fit is longer and way looser. I'll try doing that and see if it's a keeper (again).
review.name: Improved fit = bigger

review.reviewBody:
Amazing shirt and a go-to for me, especially for personal travel.  Material has a linen type feel but does not wrinkle and holds its shape much better than linen - more durable.  Also not scratchy on the skin like some cheaper alternatives.  Great for a hot day, almost in replace of a broken in Hawaiian shirt but nice enough to wear out to dinner, etc.

I own it in both the Sand Stone tan and the Green colors.  Periodically check to see if Fjallraven has released a light sky blue, which to me would be the best color… please make one Fjallraven!  I’d buy two ;)
review.name: Go-to shirt for summer travel

review.reviewBody: I’ve only owned a couple of these for a month or so, but I think I’ve found the perfect summer shirt. Stylish, versatile, comfortable, and wrinkle-resistant. I wore it for a beach day this past weekend when I wasn’t on the water, am thinking of how I can dress it up for a casual summer wedding next month, and won’t leave on any summer trips/vacations without them. I usually like a slimmer fit, but this is a perfect relaxed fit. I’m not swimming in the material, but it’s also very airy and comfortable, and just fitted enough to look really nice. I can’t thank Fjallraven enough for carrying size xs in men’s!! If I had to pick a gripe with the shirt it’s that it doesn’t have 100% full mobility when completely lifting your arms out and above your head, but I also know that’s not what this shirt is intended for. Terrific product and a fair price for how exceptional it is.
review.name: Versatile Summer Shirts

review.reviewBody: Love this shirt. Very lightweight and super breathable. Perfect for the summer and also dries quickly and packs very easily.
review.name: Awesome summer shirt

review.reviewBody: I now own the Orange, White, Green, Navy Blue, Sand and Patina Green short sleeve shirts as well as Green and Sand long sleeve ones. they are absolutely perfect for travel as the dry in a few hours so easy to wash and wear. without the need for an iron. They are ideal in the summer as they fill their role perfectly.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody:
Perfect shirt for my potato shaped body.  I vary between medium and large, depending on the brand, with either the chest or the waist or the shoulders or the sleeves being too tight.  The medium shirt fits me perfectly in all those areas just the way it’s cut!

Already have purchased two - will buy more!
review.name: Great fit..for me

review.reviewBody: I just bought two of these at REI. The moment you put them on you feel cooler. I’m a big fan of linen shirts in summer, and the hemp with these shirts have the same feel. However, they are lighter than most linen shirts. I’m 6’3” tall and the XXL is perfect for me. I hope they keep this style and add colors. The only problem with linen shirts is they usually come in bright pastels. With good colorways, this shirt can really be a great asset in the summer. The travel aspect is no joke, these are light as air and so easy to pack.
review.name: Super nice for summer

review.reviewBody: I own two of these shirts and overall am quite pleased with them. They are very comfortable, well-ventilated, and timeless - ideal for the summer. The only complaint I have is that there seems to be something wrong with the dye/fabric. There are spots on the fabric that are turning orange/brown, and every time I take it out of my dresser, another discolored spot seems to appear. At first, I thought it may be something that I was doing during the day to stain the fabric or perhaps something in my washer/detergent that was causing it. However, both of the shirts have been plagued by this issue, not just one of them. Additionally, none of my other clothes are affected by this weird discoloration, so I doubt it has anything to do with the way I do my laundry.
review.name: Very comfortable, but disappointed in fabric

name: Ovik Travel Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my daughter just learning to ski. We previously had season rentals from a local shop and they were quite worn out, so we decided to upgrade. It was amazing to see how much better my daughter could walk in these boots and she seemed much happier and in control on her skis. They are easy to get on and off and you can tell how much more comfortable they are for her. For reference my daughter wears a size 9 shoe and we purchased a 16.0
review.name: Comfortable and warm for toddlers

review.reviewBody: Really disappointed that the 14.5 is the same boot as the bigger sizes just with a smaller liner in it.
review.name: It's a big shell with a small liner
comment: Thank you for your opinion about Salomon product. We are really sorry to hear about your disappointment. This feedback will be reported to our product manager. Hopefully, we will be able to improve our product line or offer a product that will better suit your needs in the future.

review.reviewBody: We purchased this boot for our son in December 2019 but he did not start skiing regularly until November 2020. As a comfortable and cozy boot for a never-ever preschooler it ticks all the boxes. Beware of wet-weather skiing because they can get quite damp inside - they are not super waterproof. However, as our 3-year-old son has progressed, the boot definitely has it’s limitations. The primary issue being that the ratchet loosens significantly while he skis meaning that he begins to lose control and we have to keep stopping to retighten them. This is a little disappointing. Otherwise they have held up okay and meet the basic needs for a good price point.
review.name: Ratchet loosens while skiing
comment:
Hi there, 

Thank you for your feedback on our product. 

We are sorry to hear that you had an issue with your product, and apologize for any inconvenience caused. 

We would like you to know that your feedback will be reported to our product manager and we will contact you internally to assist you with this situation. Have a great day

name: T1 Boot - Kids'

hasVariant.name: Niad VCS Climbing Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Five Ten Niad VCS Climbing Shoe - Women's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: quality is great. color is as expected. hope there were more options of colorway. sizing is small. i am a 6USW in regular shoes. i got a size 6 for this. i would order a 7 next time.
review.name: grear color but small sizing

review.reviewBody: Unclear that the shoes are in women's sizes, would be better if the product clearly displayed this information.
review.name: Difficult to find gender of product.

review.reviewBody: The break in of this shoe was well worth it! When I first got them they were somewhat painful but I stuck it out and now they are becoming my favorite shoes for climbing. Trustworthy on edges and smearing is not a problem. I’ve used them on sport routes and bouldering. Good all around shoe!
review.name: Excellent show for intermediate technical climbing

review.reviewBody: The sizes are over 2 sizes too small and I already factored in the gender sizing. How can this be so far off in sizing?  Pictured is men's 8 1/2 which fits perfectly and right is 8 1/2 womens. They should be equal in size but at least an inch smaller.
review.name: Sizing way too small

review.reviewBody: Love the shoe itself! Seems like there is some quality/sizing control issues. I’ve been getting the same shoe in the same size for years and it works wonderfully for me! They don’t always fit exactly the same but have always been wearable. This go around, the same size was so small that I could barely get my foot inside, and knew no amount of stretching would fix it. Thinking the sizing system changed, I exchanged for half a size bigger…which are now too big and cause my heel to slip.
review.name: Great shoe, inconsistent sizing.

review.reviewBody:
The shoes are very comfortable. They fit right.
I think I could have gone one size down but I am also fine with how they fit for now. They have a great grip so now complains.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody:
I recently had an issue with my toe nail and I was looking for a comfy shoe that allowed me to climb without compromising my toe nail again.
These shoes are perfect. I ordered my real size but I think I could have go one down. However, I am going to keep them as it is as they are perfect to climb for conditioning.
review.name: Comfy and grippy

review.reviewBody: Safety first and these shoes are perfect fit light and strong
review.name: Definitely yes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shoes are super comfortable and I love how the rubber sticks to the wall. I’m an indoor climber and I smear a lot so these are great shoes for me.
review.name: Favorite climbing shoe

review.reviewBody: Low volumen versión, ideal for my feet shape. Quite confortable and as good quality as the old Anasazy with improved heel
review.name: Quite confortable and still performant

name: Niad VCS Climbing Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Union Charger PRO Splitboard Binding - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite splitboard bindings, and I’ve tried all the big brands. These are lighter than regular Charger's, feel like they have have a slightly stiffer baseplate, and have more supportive asymmetrical hi backs. The ride quality is very responsive while maintaining quality board feel. I ride these on a Spring Break Powder Racer split, which is like a soft flexing short-fat board with a tight sidecut. Having a nice responsive binding on a wide board is a great match. Allows me to get it up on edge with less effort and navigate with precision. Big fan of Bryan Iguchi too so I had to get his signature color haha love em.
review.name: Ride precisely with intuition

name: Charger PRO Splitboard Binding - 2025

description: Buy the Mountain House Yellow Curry online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Yellow Curry
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain House Yellow Curry online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This meal is as close as you can get to restaurant quality.   This is a must in your line up of Mountain House meals.
review.name: One of the best!

review.reviewBody: This is MH's best tasting product by far. Very similar to Asian style curries. Really, really delicious.
review.name: Best tasting product from MH!

review.reviewBody: surpassed all expectation and have already reordered
review.name: surpassed all ecpectations

review.reviewBody: Love the taste,chicken very good alone with rice, curry taste very fresh
review.name: Simple to make

review.reviewBody: This dish has SHRIMP in it even though it says Chicken and Rice. Beware if you don't eat shrimp due to allergies or for any personal reasons. And they won't refund you if you bought it and then have to throw it away because it has shrimp in it.
review.name: Falsely Advertised as Chicken/Rice - No Refunds!

review.reviewBody: we have purchased over 100 of these because they have good flavor that we both like.
review.name: Very good

review.reviewBody: Pleasantly surprised how tasty this curry is. Just enough spice to make it taste like a Thai restaurant bought meal.
review.name: My new favorite

review.reviewBody: Amazing flavor! So glad I took a chance on this one. Well worth the purchase !
review.name: Awesome Flavor!! My new favorite!!

review.reviewBody: To be fair, I haven't tried the Pad Thai (yet) and it was difficult to pick just one entree as my all-time favorite. Although I've never been disappointed with any of them,  I have to choose Yellow Curry as #1 on my list. I always order a larger quantity of the curry over the others. I can't help it. It's that good!
review.name: It doesn't get any better than this!

review.reviewBody: My wife and I couldn't get over how incredibly flavorful the Yellow Curry with Chicken is. It satisfies the palate with a multitude of complex ingredients and flavors.  This is now one our top go to meals.
review.name: Yellow Curry with Chicken - Wow!

name: Yellow Curry

hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon S/Lab Ultra 10 LTD Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is the only salomon vest I can wear over tanktop, as the material is so soft that it doesn't rub the skin over long distance. The quiver attachments works great.
What I don't like about this vest is that the front pockets are so loose that my phone jumps out of the pocket on faster descents.
review.name: lightweight & stretchable

review.reviewBody: I like it. This did not cause neck chafing in my last 100 miler unlike their S/Lab 5L that they used to sell. The sizing of this pack is questionable. I should go with 2XS from their size chart. But it was too tight to put on/off, though it fits well once it’s on. I chose to go with XS.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: You sent me the wrong item. You didn’t even send me a vest. It was some weird belt thing. Waste of time
review.name: Terrible
comment: We’re sorry to hear that you received the wrong item in your order. We’ve sent you an email to resolve this mix-up and provide the next steps. Thank you for your understanding as we work to correct this.

review.reviewBody: Love the fit of this vest. Great for training runs that have me away from civilization-carries everything. Feels like i dont have anything on and doesnt squeeze or chaf my neckline. Worth the hefty price
review.name: My go to vest

review.reviewBody: Incomparable to the Sense Pro 10, which remains the gold standard. The water bottle pockets are too deep and the elastics don't hold the top of the bottle up. You spend your whole run fishing those out and worrying about what is falling out of the pockets that don't have zippers. Wish I never bought it.
review.name: Awful

review.reviewBody:
I had no trouble packing all my gear for a 50k in the high mountains without any support.
I had issues with the bungy cord that should keep the flasks from sliding in the pocket. But more importantly, there was a strong chlorine aftertaste in the water that comes out of the flasks sold with the pack.
review.name: Spacious!

review.reviewBody: Very good product, so happy used last couple o runa and i like so much
review.name: Excelente product

review.reviewBody: I bought the vest and quiver qnd about two miles into the first training run to familiarise my self with its feel on a long run I suffered exactly the same failure on the loop for the toggle to attach to as the two other reviews on here. Absolutely devastating as it's the best fitting vest I've had but really shoddy stiching.
review.name: Great vest but .....
comment:
Thank you for taking the time to write to us.

We are sorry to hear that your product is not giving you complete satisfaction.

All products are guaranteed for 2 years from the date of purchase against any manufacturing defect. In the event that your product is defective, the warranty will apply.

Do not hesitate to contact us via our guaranteed request form for an evaluation:
https://www.salomon.com/en-gb/contact/warranty

We would be delighted to help you.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this item for an 110km Ultra and within 40k both loops to attach the pole quiver had snapped. 

Overall, the quality of the stitching is not very good and the material around the top has already started to rip, I'm not sure how long this product will last or if this is fit for another race.
review.name: Great storage, lightweight, and comfortable but...
comment:
Thank you for taking the time to write to us.

We are sorry to hear that your product is not giving you complete satisfaction.

All products are guaranteed for 2 years from the date of purchase against any manufacturing defect. In the event that your product is defective, the warranty will apply.

Do not hesitate to contact us via our guaranteed request form for an evaluation:
https://www.salomon.com/en-gb/contact/warranty

We would be delighted to help you.

review.reviewBody: Item was delivered and and one of the loops snapped of while trying to add the pole tote. The way the loops are attached is questionable about the manufacturing quality. Bummer because the rest is perfect. But the loop is absolutely necessary to me.
review.name: Fits like a glove, questionable quality
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products. Not only that, but we will contact you, so we can check if your product has a material or manufacturing defect, and we will help you set up a claim. Thank you.

name: S/Lab Ultra 10 LTD Set

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Rip Ruck 32L Daypack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Has proved a capable backpack for day-to-day activities and the moderately strenuous outdoor activities I've take it on so far. The large main compartment and solid construction allow me to carry items, the water bottle/side pockets are useful, and the outside pockets can hold more than I expected while still being easily accessible. Fits and distributes the weight well. I really like the rip-style opening of the main pocket for accessibility and security. 

However, some of the pack's features do not seem to meet the intended purpose. The back-facing molle weave between the two exterior pockets is too small for most accessories. I've used bungee cords to hold jackets and other foldable items there, but securely attaching anything of that size requires multiple cords, which makes it hard to reach quickly and partially interferes with the other pockets. Similarly, the placement of the molle-exterior upper side side pockets is too low to attach additional pouches without interfering with access to the water bottle pockets. I carry a Nalgene, which impeded the bottom rows of the molle weave on whatever side I'm carrying the bottle. Having any substantially sized or weighted accessory either interferes with access to the bottle, won't fit, or, if I can only put something on side, throws off the profile and balance of the pack. 

I feel like I'd have to shop for/use products that are too small/niche to justify their place on pack if I want to get any use out of the molle sections. Molle on the flat bottom of the pack, on the lid where the logo and Velcro are, or on the shoulder straps might be more useful. Additionally, the low profile/cut-away style of the molle sections feel less durable or secure the more conventional weave styles I've seen. 

Overall, solidly made pack with good storage, but the design and placement of some of its features make it less versatile/modular than it could be or than other "tactical" style packs.
review.name: Solid pack overall; MOLLE features miss the mark

review.reviewBody:
First and foremost - this isn't a "they changed things, and I don't like change"

I've been everywhere with the previous version of the Rip Ruck 24. It's been my favorite pack by far, and it's held up to EVERYTHING. I always felt like I needed a bit more room, so it was time to snag the 32.  Mystery Ranch took all of the soul out of this bag. I ride a motorcycle with two large laptops, and I'm honestly worried about things falling out. The mag-buckle system on the two rip pouches NEVER needed to be removed. I kept a charger in one, and a larger power brick int he other. I don't know if I trust the two rip pouches to not dump my stuff on the highway. It's just, man... what a bummer. It's a shell of the bag it was. Boring color options as well. 

There were some good additions made, but they fall into the "well I should hope so/should've been there from the start" category. I think the internal storage is laid out better. The straps and yoke system are definitely better, as are the hip straps. Water bottle pockets are handy. But it's a lot of features removed, and a lot of 'every pack has these' features added. It's a now a sad, middling bag, and no longer worth the price. 

Off to eBay to find a used previous gen 32. If you love your RipRuck, and you should, this is not the same.
review.name: New Version Is a Downgrade.

review.reviewBody: Very happy with this backpack it meets all my needs for my daily work life. Great quality as expected from this company.
review.name: Solid Backpack

review.reviewBody: Fantastic pack. It’s extremely durable and does exactly what I wanted and expected. I got it to go with my Scree. The modularity when it comes to fitment sets it clearly apart from many other brands. Great job as usual Mystery Ranch!
review.name: Great Piece of Gear

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this bag. The side pockets are so useful and handy. The fact that they seal even without the zipper closed is great for when you're going in and out of pockets. The separate laptop pocket is so useful! The only thing I'd fix is the top flap is a little floppy so it doesn't always catch the magnets. Maybe having a little more sturdy material to help keep it more ridged would fix the issue
review.name: Amazing quality and functional

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a daily work backpack. It is phenomenal! Exceptionally well-made, tough as nails, includes awesome features (e.g., magnetic closures), and it is comfortable.
review.name: Perfect for Work

review.reviewBody: I spent many a year in multiple backpacks worth of trying to find the right one. I need something sturdy But light enough for me to take to work or school. I work in the medical field and I need a big Pack in order for need to take an extra pair of scrubs socks, and yes, the occasional change of shoes. This pack changes the game. I’ve taken it everywhere. Work, school and Travel. I put in a heavy 16 inch MacBook Pro and an 12.9 inch iPad Pro for nursing school and it still is comfortable. I got rid of the hip belts, I only use hip belts in the backcountry but other then that  I love this pack, it will my go to every day nursing pack.
review.name: A Nursing students dream backpack

review.reviewBody: Phenomenal quality and very nice design. Extremely easy access with the rip-zip lid and the rip-zip exterior compartments. I love how Mystery Ranch managed to essentially build a modern ruck from the ALICE pack. Super simple and effective.
review.name: Very well built, very easy access

review.reviewBody: Material is great. Easy access to everything and comfortable to wear.
review.name: Great Backpack

review.reviewBody: I have the smaller Rip-Ruck and I loved it, but found it to be a bit small for some applications, so I bought the bigger one for daily use. Only complaints would be that the bottle holders on the side have a hard time holding larger bottles like a standard Nalgene bottle. When you set the back down bottles always want to fall out. Also wish the bigger bag had the same zipper all the way down the front like the smaller one but these struggles are splitting hairs. Over all great versatility and durability.
review.name: Great Pack-Most durable pack I own

name: Rip Ruck 32L Daypack

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I just added this bib short to my collection for long days in the saddle. I’m 1.77 m height and 85 kg weight and size M fits perfectly. The padding is very good and Lycra is compressive but not as much as the Equipe series
review.name: Super comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Speechless.  I've worn a lot of different bibs, and these bibs are just second to none.  The compression is amazing.  They truly fit like a glove.  Pad is thick and dense - perfect for long rides.  Materials are abstolutely top quality.  Worth every penny of the $143.  Seriously, these are amazing bibs.  

6'2" - L and fit is perfect.
review.name: Unbelievable fit and quality

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good fit, very comfortable
review.name: Assos

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I own two pairs of older Assos S5 bib shorts, which I always liked and fit really good.  However, these Assos GTS shorts (size M) had a really odd cut at the leg grippers.  The opening was wider than the quad section of shorts.  My wife said they looked liked bellbottom shorts....  I  own several different brands of shorts (Santini, Giordana and Assos) and all of those shorts are smaller diameter around the gripper near one's knees, basically normal leg shape.  Larger diameter around the quad and smaller diameter above the knees.  

If this is how they are designed, I cannot recommend.  Very disappointing coming from a high end bike short.
review.name: Leg opening too large

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m 6’2 205 and got the XL. Fit is perfect for my very long legs. Zero chafing and very comfy.
review.name: Buzzworthy

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
What? 
Been road biking for about two years now. Have purchased a wide variety of bib shorts from economy brands to Q365 and Rapha. These are by far the best fitting most comfortable bib shorts I have owned.  All the other high end brands look "race fit" but at the same time, "feel" race fit. Assos however look race fit amazing (yes it does matter to me) but way more importantly are as comfortable as anything I have felt. 
Well worth the $$
review.name: Wow! This is what they should feel like

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Assos amazes me more and more. their products do have the edge over others with design specifically for a cyclist's anatomy.
review.name: amazing quality and fit

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody: About 500 miles on these bibs and I am really impressed.  Awesome construction and materials.  Comfortable on 8hr+ rides.  Assos is expensive, but worth it IMO.
review.name: Great bibs for long rides

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well constructed shorts and a nice pad but they are considerably shorter than expected. I'm 6'0"/190lbs/34"inseam & these are XL. I ordered the "normal" version and not the long. Would have returned but discovery was made after wearing and they'll likely be worn under MTB shorts- again, nice pad. Have recently (within past year) purchased Giordana's FC-R short and Rapha's Brevet short. FC-R are favorite (well constructed, great pad) and Rapha's are super nice (great fabric, don't like pad as much as FC-R but still really nice). The Mille GTS C2 are nice bibs but for the price, I'll order another pair of FC-R instead for the next pair of high bibs in the rotation.
review.name: Nice pad but too short

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I went from size M to size S; read good reviews about these bib shorts and agree. Snug fig but comfortable.  I’m very much a recreational rider, buy I like to push myself.  I ride at elevation 2000 -2200 m above sea level with lots of climbing and downhill descents, long stretches of flat with head, cross, and tailwinds.  Rides are at a minimum of 2 and up to 3 1/2 hours (goal is to reach 100 km).  Independent of the conditions or length of the ride, these bib shorts are never an issue.
review.name: New bib shorts

name: Mille GTS Bib Short C2 - Men's

hasVariant.name: Aspect DSLR 22L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Aspect DSLR 22L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this bag for over a year now, and my disappointment continues to grow. At first I thought it was great, as I really wanted it to carry most of my gear and some room for persoanl items during flights especially. BUt the more I use it, the more I realize it's just poorly designed to fit much of anything. I barely have space for my leses in the bottom compartment, and the lack of thoughtful pockets means I'm always fumbling for little things like batteries, keys, or cards etc. 
Also, I didn''t realize how much not having a spot to slip over luggage handles would affect me, but it does greatly. I was choosing between this one at the time and another brand bag that did have this and I regretit literally everytime I fly.
Additionally, one of the zipper pulls has broken on the side compartment which is disappointing. I really just overestimated how durable and how much this bag would fit, plus the lack of pockets I also didn't realize would be so frustrating over time.
review.name: Really dissapointed.

review.reviewBody: Great backpack, carries all the equipment I need and very comfortable to wear. Bought a separate rain fly in case of sudden downpours but the backpack does well with light rain already without it.
review.name: Quality backpack!

review.reviewBody: Flat landings. Double ejections. Battlestar Galactica. My pack has seen it all. My camera? Sleeps in there like a baby. As a certified loose cannon, I tend to plan on skiing kinda chill with my camera and then wind up hucking my meat into oblivion. Philosophers have been asking the same question for years, what does it all mean? Well so far, the common denominator is time. Spend it wisely. Buy the right pack, drop the cliff, take the photo, give them a story to tell.
review.name: Tomohawk Extrordinaire

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love my Thule Aspect backpack! I have seen tons of different backpacks, but I truly feel I made the best decision with this one. I consistently haul my mirrorless SLR, 3 lenses, filter pack, extra batteries and memory card holder all in the lower part. I am able to use the side access to pull the camera out on the go, and switch lenses if needed. In the upper portion I use the separate pockets to organize my smaller stuff, and have plenty of room for 2 medium packing cubes. I haul my tripod in the right side pocket, my laptop and tablet in the slim full length pocket, and in the outer rear pocket, I have gloves and a few other things. I loaded this thing up and have traveled all over the place, it takes the beatings with ease while protecting my equipment. I hope Thule continues with this design! One suggestion would be to add another pocket to the left side on the side access door, with a strap up top.
review.name: Travel camera all in one.

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a bike to take skiing and biking without spending too much.  For the price, there is not a better DSLR bag, I am able to take 2 mirrorless cameras, GoPro Hero 7, small light, shotgun mic, a Mavic Pro 2 in the top pouch and a iPad if needed.  The bag is not designed for hard riding or skiing but everything is well protected for some easy rides to get some shots.  The flat bottom allows the bag to stand on its own if needed and the straps are light but durable.  The hip belt is the real gem in this bag, makes it functional for light biking, hiking or skiing and does not get too hot on your back due to the smaller footprint.
review.name: Simple, Light and Portable

review.reviewBody: Really comfy, took this backpack for my Nikon D810 out around New York City for a day of photo taking, didn't really sore my back or my shoulders. Although the storage compartment on top of the camera storage part is a bit too small, can't put much stuff but at least it can still hold back Macbook Pro 13 pretty well at the back sleeve. Other than that its a really well made backpack and definitely looking forward to bring it along my other adventures! 9/10
review.name: Amazing and Versatile Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Really good DSLR backpack but giving 3 star only due to small flaw which mentioned in the end. Outside don't give any impression that this is camera backpack. It looks like regular bag which is really good and sometime it is safer too. 

It has enough space. I have fitting Nikon full frame dslr with 24 70, tamron 70 210, small Tripod and all accessories inside. Also it has good storage space on top. Able to fit laptop and tab and tripod outside. Padding are really good and steady. Bag is not too heavy compare to other Thule models. After keeping everything inside, ya it is heavy : )

Also padding section can be completely removable so can use like a regular bag. Really good design and impressive materials and quality.

Keep in mind, It don't have water proof cover like Thule perspertiv. But has laptop area which other models of thule don't have in dslr bags. 

Everything looks good before I found some small flaw in design. See the 2nd picture, the padding on the back feels very sharp inside. May be try to cut the top layer of the back cloth. Not sure what will happen but I am keeping the bag as I like the other features and design. Let's see if it breaks. I think it is design issue and not just with my bag. Hope it will not have any issue..
review.name: 3 stars out of 5. Good dslr bag but Read till end.

review.reviewBody: This pack has a lot more storage space than you would think! The camera protection is spot on! I love the secret laptop/tablet compartment. Love that it fits my laptop, drone, camera, batteries, and chargers, plus all the extra stuff I like to carry with me. I have enough extra space for a jacket, some food, etc. After using this on a 2 week trip to Hawaii, I wont use any other camera bag!
review.name: Hands Down the Best Travel Camera Bag!

name: Aspect DSLR 22L Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome jacket my daughter loves the color warm enough for her for school when it’s cold
review.name: Cute jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket for winter. Not too heavy or bulky true to size. Very warm material inside highly recommend. Good color options as well.
review.name: Stylish winter jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Granddaughter LOVES! It's her favorite color and looks great on her. She got so excited when she opened the package. I couldn't have found anything any better or her.
review.name: Granddaughter LOVES!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice jacket, soft and plush, my granddaughter will love it!!
review.name: Very nice jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality jacket especially for cooler fall weather. It's cozy and warm. My daughter likes it, but says it fits boxy.
review.name: Cozy but boxy.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for a jacket that my daughter, who isn't a big fan of layers, would be able to wear and still stay warm on cold New England days as we transition into winter. This jacket is the perfect thickness, she love the inside and how soft and fuzzy it is, and there is still room to wear a sweatshirt underneath if absolutely needed. It's easy for her to zip up as well and the pockets are a decent size. We use to have to fit with layers due to only have a fleece or super puffy winter jacket to pick from, and this jacket as eliminated all of those issues. Glad I finally purchased a jacket like this for her.
review.name: Perfect for kids who don't like layers.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter loves the coat and keeps her very warm.
review.name: Very warm coat love the color , has pockets very .

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It has the coziest lining. My daughter loved the colors inside and outside. Warm enough for the fall.
review.name: Cozy cozy lining.

review.reviewBody: Been waiting a while to get one of these but they were always out of stock. Had high expectations based on the marketing. This thing is just ok, pretty mediocre in the whole spectrum of jerseys I've owned. It has many pockets but compared to other jerseys the 3 main pockets are smaller so the overall storage space isn't much more. Instead it leaves you fumbling around unzipping all these different pockets to get things out.  The fabric is thick and not very stretchy, so not the most comfortable out there. Quality seems ok, probably will last a long time.
review.name: It's just ok

name: Brevet Lightweight Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to like this pack as it generally sits comfortably and snug and seems great for run commuting, hiking and cycling. The back panel is cushy and the material is super lightweight. 
However, when hanging a full hydration reservoir inside the designated loop on the inside, the top part of the pack collapses into a fold due to the lack of structure. The fold gets uncomfortable and annoying for the upper back really quickly. Seems like a major design issue to me. Also, all the straps are so stiff that they need two hands to adjust which can get bothersome when running or cycling.
review.name: Comfortable pack with one major flaw
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

name: XT 15L Set
